links_reviews_text: A great fit top, easy to pair with anything. Can dress it up or down!
Nice quality fabric. Arm holes were a big gaping for my petite frame, but not horrible. Also was too much fabric to tuck in as I had planned.
Large and flows. Might want to size down. Looks good tucked in with fitted skirt or loose with skinny jeans and heels.

links_reviews_title: fantastic top - very flattering - easy, polished look
links_reviews_text: fit was true to size, got many compliments, would rent again
This top is perfect to wear under a fun moto jacket in the winter. I wore it several times while I had it! True to size.
I wore out with a fur jacket with friends! Works with a bunch of different pieces and very flattering
I wore this under a few cardigans and blazers and it was perfect. Comfortable, moveable fabric and not too right around the neck. 10/10!
I really liked this top! It was high quality material.

links_reviews_title: Can definitely be used as a staple!
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size and lays well. Can be paired with skinny pants as the top is a little bulky by the waist and ends.

links_reviews_title: Elegant with a slightly tight neck
links_reviews_text: I like basics with good shapes, and this fits the bill. The fabric is high enough quality to sit and move nicely. My one beef is with the high neck; the very top felt a little constricting, so I only wore it once. If it weren't for that, I might have bought it.

links_reviews_title: Great top for work into evening
links_reviews_text: Cute top. A lot of fabric around the middle so best tucked in to high wasted pants. Great look.
Great top! I wore this with a skirt and it was a little bulky tucked in. I'd rent it again to go with skinny cut pants, not tucked or front tucked
Didn't wear - too high-waisted to be comfortable. But I have a short torso, so people who aren't will be fine.

The fabric is of decent quality, but the sizing is off. I am reliably a size 31R or US 12 in denim in high-waisted jeans and this fit two sizes too small; completely unable to button it. I had rented to wear out on my quarantine grocery runs and balcony lounging, but alas will be returning promptly.
Loved this but had lots of pilling and looked very worn in. Would have bought it otherwise-fit and style were great.
Stretchy waistband and cute

Loved this skirt but it went down to the floor, required me to roll the waistline several times before I got it to proper midi length. Looked cute with a sweater and heels for the office. Could also be great with a white T and sneakers for a casual spring look.
Very cute skirt with great fit. Material was thicker so it helped flatter where silk can be a little to revealing. Loved the color and it worked well with a tee shirt and chunky sweater.

links_reviews_title: Love this skirt, material looks expensive
links_reviews_text: This skirt fall super nice and the material looks good, even though it's a bit shinny it can be dress down with a black shirt. It also creates a great silhouette.

links_reviews_title: Great skirt! (Once I put spanx on underneath)
links_reviews_text: Loved this skirt! The material did show off my hips more than I usually like but once I put spanx on I thought it looked a lot better!

links_reviews_title: Great Quality and Waistline, but a little long
links_reviews_text: The only reason I couldn't give this 5 stars is because the skirt is long and comes down to my mid calf

I loved this skirt! Very comfortable and flattering. I think this skirt would be perfect dressed up for a formal occasion or dressed down for everyday wear. I paired this with a tshirt and sneakers and got a ton of compliments.

links_reviews_title: So pretty and feminine, goes with everything anywhere
links_reviews_text: I love this skirt. The fabric feels so smooth and luxurious - it's thicker than I expected and it feels like good quality. This drapes beautifully and is so comfortable. I've worn it so many times! To work, out to bars, to a party, wandering around Barcelona on vacation (pictured), and even to the airport. The color is pretty and unique without being crazy. Love this. Highly recommend.
The skirt is so comfortable omg, and with an elastic waistband it's so easy! Considering buying but it definitely wrinkles very easy. Would definitely rent again!
Ended up loving the quality and fit of the skirt! Such a pretty color too
Beautiful color and perfect length. Can be dressed up or down
Unable to wear; COVID
Comfortable, lightweight. Pretty color that was easy to match with a top. Casual or more dressed up. Nothing not to love!
Size up in this skirt because it doesn't have any stretch. I wore this for Thanksgiving dinner and noticed it wrinkled a bit from sitting down, but other than that it was good
Totally unflattering, need to size up

links_reviews_title: Cute to wear with an oversized sweater
links_reviews_text: I'm 5'3" so it was a little longer on me (mid calf), but still loved it. The waistband is SO much better than other silky midi skirts like this because it's a thick elastic, not that weird foldover elastic. The fabric itself is also thicker than other similar skirts I've rented (and bought), which I loved.
nice length and really cool color. Every undergarment shows bumps through though, so choose a no-line panty.

RTR was out of large which is what they recommended for me, so I got the extra large with the intent of wearing them to hang out in the house, maybe sleep in or ride my exercise bike. When I put them on they were much tighter than I expected, I would describe them as compression leggings, mid level compression, and I do recommend sizing up. The XL was great for me, but if I had gotten the L I suspect I would have been unable to breathe and uncomfortable. They were cute otherwise with the side detail, but the colors were a bit faded.

links_reviews_title: Fun different leggings for work from home And yoga
links_reviews_text: I really like these leggings the pros are Thick wide Waist band it gives you a nice held and feeling comes right to the belly button, the stripes and details on the leggings make them fun and different rather than my usual black go to yoga leggings. Cons- wish they were a little more flattering to the booty and there's some sort of splatter/reflective design on the sides of legs that make them look almost like they are stained. Overall a keeper for a week Or two

links_reviews_title: Super cute leggings! I got SO many compliments because the sides are reflective - great rent!
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size and thick enough to not be see through - loved!

links_reviews_title: Working from home in this chic yet comfortable jumper
links_reviews_text: Beautiful denim and great fit. Love where the top and waist meet, high waist. The pants are built like jeans, fly and button, where the top has smaller buttons - gives it a 'tucked in' effect. The pants are not as long as the picture, but still chic. Comfortable for while I work-from-home over the coming days and chic enough collar for video conferences. Very tempted to keep. #roomforboobs
In general, I didn't like the color or the fit of the jumpsuit. It was right in the waist but awkward around the hips. It just wasn't for me.
I wore this for a date out with my husband. The large fit but was a bit too big. The bottom hem was hanging down below the dress line and needs a repair but I felt great in it!

links_reviews_title: Perfect dress for my holiday firm picture!
links_reviews_text: Loved how thick the fabric was, and very flattering.

links_reviews_title: Nice thick dress with low neckline
links_reviews_text: This dress had a nice heavy material and was very comfortable. It is low in the front and has a high slit that elevated it from a super conservative wrap dress. The lining in mine hung below the outer fabric but I was wearing tights and boots so you couldn't tell. The texture was unique and overall, this was an ok rental for a work event or somewhere you need to be a bit low key.
Gorgeous fabric, stunning lines that shape the body

Great material and construction. The material is thick making it a great dress for winter, fall or spring. The dress does run small and is a true wrap dress without any extra material to fudge sizing. If you're between sizes definitely size up.. maybe even size up regardless.

If you have any curves at all this won't work as a work dress! Both the low cut and the leg hem felt very revealing and I'm not too strict about that. The arms are also weirdly tight. Would work for a winter date night with how thick the fabric is.

links_reviews_title: Could not get over my arms!!
links_reviews_text: I am unsure I've ever had the problem of a size10 dress being too tight on my arms!!! The fabric was heavier than expected. It didn't feel nice enough for me to try another size. Sorry Corey dress. We tried.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful material but the size run very small.

links_reviews_text: I am not large chested at all, and this was way to right up top.

links_reviews_title: Super low cut if your chesty
links_reviews_text: Cute dress but way too low cut. No way can this be worn in a work setting without something (cami) under.

links_reviews_title: A Miss for Me: Too Much Fussing to Keep It Closed Properly
links_reviews_text: This dress felt like trying on a sweater that accidentally ended up in the dryer: tight sleeves and short body. The button closure was too far over (wide) yet the top was wide and super low cut. The wrap at the hem doesn't lay properly (you can see from the photo that the left side has a strange angle to it). I ended up keeping my scarf on at dinner with a male friend (too much cleavage), and then kept my coat on the rest of the night because we ended up playing pool. (Can you imagine what a disaster that was?!) Big fail.
Cute and flattering without being to much for work.
cute dress for a winter date night in chicago. love the fabric and the fit.

links_reviews_title: Lovely texture and thick fabric, well structured, but runs small.
links_reviews_text: I wear a size 10-12 lately and ordered a large— could not manage to button it sadly. XL should do the trick. This is a great work dress.

Rented for dinner with my husband. I am usually a pretty solid medium, but this was tight in my arms and in my butt. I still wore it (because it was what I had rented for the occasion), but I did feel uncomfortable. I just felt that if I had sized up, I would have been a little more relaxed.

links_reviews_title: Simple yet stylish dress for a work Christmas party
links_reviews_text: Loved the fabric. It was nice and thick. The bust is a little low, so I occasionally had to check that my bra wasn't showing. Very comfortable, especially for winter weather. Would rent again!

links_reviews_title: Had a meeting with stakeholders - a long day. Dress was comfy and professional.
links_reviews_text: Fit very well- I got a ton of compliments on this dress. I didn't have a bad time with the wrap coming apart.

links_reviews_title: I did not wear this dress. Plan was to wear it to a job interview but felt it was too revealing.
links_reviews_text: This dress was snug in the arms and I have pretty thin arms. Also, the neck line is too low cut for work and the slit up the front is a little questionable too. I love the material and color though!

links_reviews_title: I rented this for work and weekends. I tried it in both a medium and large and neither fit.
links_reviews_text: Beautiful shape and interesting comfortable fabric. I couldn't wear it though because it didn't close/drape properly.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous dress missing inner button to fully secure the wrap
links_reviews_text: Perfect for a cold fall day . This wrap is a better than photographed, beautifully dark and dusty blue color. A subtle corduroy pattern and medium to heavy weight dress with lining looked great with leggings and ballet flats. Unfortunately, the dress was missing it inner button to fully secure the wrap. Nevertheless, I felt it tied well enough to wear. I wore a black tank underneath for coverage and felt perfectly appropriate at my work function.

links_reviews_title: Nice fabric. Too revealing in real life.
links_reviews_text: If you have hips or a butt the leg hem is to revealing.

This is such a flattering dress, easy to wear with the wrap. Simple but the textured fabric is a little heavy and feels very nice. The cutout makes it a little sexy but it's modest overall. want to buy it bc I feel like I can wear it to work and dinner and drinks and everywhere!

links_reviews_title: Lovely dress, awful fit for my body
links_reviews_text: This dress has such a beautifully heavy, textured fabric and cut that I wanted to love, but the M was unwearable for my 5'4 136lb 36C body. I'm short waisted and curvy-- the button inside the wrap buttoned, but it was close. When I tied the wrap dress, it felt too snug around my hips, yet the top was open an gaping. The arms were also very snug. My arms are average to muscle-y... The M is suited for those with thin arms. Because of the weight of the fabric, there's not a whole lot of "give". I'd say this dress is for lean, long-torsoed women. And with the midi length in back, I think it's also a bit more flattering on taller gals. Too bad for me!
This was a regular sweater that I'm come to love from Tory Burch. The fit was good, a little bulky but I was comfy in it and would rent again.

This was my most complimented rental in quite some time. It was a little heavier than I expected but perfect for sweater weather. It's a bit oversized, I definitely could have sized down but i liked it big and comfy.
Good quality! Slightly oversized but I liked it like that.
I sized up for an oversized, boxy fit. Tuck it into some casual jeans and voila. Lots of reactions and compliments.

I wore this in a size large so I could have an oversized look. Paired with a leather A line mini and tights and flat boots for a work-appropriate edge. Compliments all day. Plus it was just fun to say this is my "chunky lil grumps sweater". xo Nic
I got lots of compliments on this sweater! It's a nice oversized shape but pretty pitchy so I had to wear a long sleeve under

This was exactly what I thought it would be. It was comfy and chunky. Not flattering in the least, but it wasn't designed to be. I got it with tags on and wore it to my office on Halloween (since no one was in the office that day). It reminded me of the sweaters I used to wear 20 years ago. The graphic was cute and it was good weekend wear.
It's honestly not the most flattering fit but it was comfortable and just what I wanted to wear on a perfect fall day
Love the fit! Just a touch scratchy or I would have given it 5 stars. Definitely worth the rental though!

I loved the tennis ball, it gives me proper school girl vibes. It had some weird bunching in the center of the graphic though and wouldn't lay flat. It's also pretty itchy and not as comfy as some other sweaters I have. Was nice and warm for transition to Winter/Spring. Prob won't rent again.

loved it, ordered a medium because I wanted a more oversized fit (i'm normally a small). I will say that the sweater I received had some pills and I wish that RTR would remove those (they're my pet peeve with sweaters), but otherwise a great sweater.
It fit perfectly and was so comfortable.

links_reviews_title: Cute baggy looks good with leggings or tucked into high waisted jeans
I probably should have sized down but this sweater was amazing
links_reviews_text: Weather expressing a grumpy mood or looking to be sporty-- this sweater caught a lot of eyes! I should have gotten my normal size M or L but it wasn't available so it was extra baggy.
I LOVE this sweater and want to keep it. It's so unique and the orange face pops on the white sweater. I have to rent it again.
not oversized, so order up!
I'm all for a chunky sweater. This is not the one.
True to size (oversize but it's supposed to be). Should have grabbed the large but still loved.

Loved loved loved! So cozy and comfortable. I was scared bc I usually can't wear wool, but I wore a tshirt underneath and didn't itch at all. I wore with leggings and it was the perfect length/shape. Obsessed and didn't want to return.
Runs big! Fun to wear.

links_reviews_title: Oversized, cute & comfy, but the material pills
links_reviews_text: I rented this to serve as a cute but comfortable sweater to travel in. At first I considered returning for a size S because it is so oversized but my friends talked me out of it. I ended up loving it as a trendy "sweatshirt," wearing it over leggings on a weekend and on the plane, with black jeans and booties at work. Got lots of compliments and questions as to whether this was a face or a tennis ball (which I think it might be both?). By the end of my rental, the material was definitely pilling, which was surprising for a $250+ sweater. I think I was the first to wear it, so who knows how long this item will last as it gets rented over and over again.
I tried styling the shorts with belts, jackets, basic tees, extravagant tops, but there was just no hiding the saggy diaper look. Cheap material and cheap production.

This was a great lightweight dress for dinner. The flair in the front is cute. Being pear shaped it did get a little tight around my hips and I’ve never worn a size 10. I’m usually a 6/8 or 28/29. That said, I loved it! Just go up a size. Would buy or rent again.

Loved this dress! Glad I sized up one because it fit and I felt great - might have been a little too tight in my normal size. Normally don't love shift dresses but this one didn't fit like a box. Subtle ruffle in the front and fitted in the back.

Loose, drop-waisted feel, but the length and cute ruffles on the front keep it from feeling frumpy. Wish I'd gotten a better picture! Got compliments all day. I wore with cute kitten heel mule sandals.

links_reviews_title: Small in hips but beautiful colors and pattern! Classy!
links_reviews_text: As other reviewers mentioned, this runs a bit small in the hips. Everywhere else fit great! The first thing I noticed was the volume in the ruffles on the front at the bottom - those are super cute, but it is straight in the back so they don't go all the way around the dress. I loved the pattern and colors. Overall this was a great rental and so classy!

The fit of this dress is easy, and although at first I thought it would be a little mature for me (the fabric texture reminds me of something my grandma would wear), I liked it for the office. The front ruffle stumps me a bit because it doesn't continue to the back. So from the side it almost looks like you're wearing the dress backward.

I wore this to work in July for a slightly more casual look. Fit is straight and boxy but still cute. The fabric is lighter than I expected, especially after renting the pink/solid version of this dress from VVB. This one has a viscose shell; RTR got it wrong in the notes (lining is polyester)

This is very cute, and very lightweight even with the lining. Its a true sheath shape - very boxy at the waist and narrower through the hips although I didn't need to size up. Despite the boxy silhouette it is still flattering. Perfect for looking like a professional human on a sticky summer day in NYC.

links_reviews_title: Never worn, strange fit for anyone with any semblance of hips
links_reviews_text: Unless you have a very slim, athletic body type, this dress probably won't suit you. This dress is so narrow at the hips/butt that even though it fits, it bunches unflatteringly. Also the ruffles at the front don't continue to the back, emphasising the awkward fit of this dress from the back, in particular. It was so unflattering I sent it back immediately. Good quality material though.
fit well but I felt it was a bit too long

links_reviews_title: Fun work dress for a tropical office
links_reviews_text: I wore this to some offsite meetings in a tropical location and it was a fun, comfortable dress for the day. It does run small so make sure to size 1-2 sizes up. It fits larger busts without being boxy and the length was fine for work, if you are short (I'm 5'2"). I loved the colors and the material and I would definitely rent again for my next trip to this site. Bonus - it travels well!

links_reviews_title: Cute dress for preppy Florida vacation
links_reviews_text: I got the larger size (14 UK, 10 US) based on reviews about sizing and wish I had gotten the right size. Very cute dress but not fitted through the waist, so the larger size was just too big. Not the most exciting rental but comfortable and perfect for a long weekend holiday to Boca Grande, Florida, which is very preppy.
Size up if you are curvy - this runs small and is super boxy, but an amazing party dress that can be worn in the evening or daytime.

links_reviews_title: Love the classic print and sleek design.
links_reviews_text: This fits well on an athletic frame and is comfy for all-day wear.
Great work to night dress. Other reviews warned about a weird ruffle - it rides up just a bit - but overall really cute
Loved this dress. Made for a more slender body type so I will be sizing up when I rent again just so it's not as fitted on my back side. Otherwise, I absolutely loved it! Great colors and quality

links_reviews_title: cute, easy dress for work in the summer
links_reviews_text: Fits TTS so this was a little big for me, but the pattern and loose fit made it great for work to happy hour. Got several compliments. Length is ok for petites.
Flattering with out revealing too much! Great bold, beautiful colors. Made very well and classy!
I am normally a size 6 but tried this in a 14 because I knew it ran small. A 12 would have fit perfectly.
Fit great, slightly loose in the stomach area but did not make me look disproportioned. Cute for everyday or dress it up.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous dress, tight in the hips
links_reviews_text: Gorgeous fabric and bright print. Very tighter in the hips, so if you have hips size up. I'm usually a size 4 (US) and the size 8 (UK) was too small.

links_reviews_title: Nice for work or a daytime shower.
links_reviews_text: Beautiful colors and material. Fit is off, it is very tight through hips and upper thigh, but loose in stomach area. Can be pulled off, but I probably wouldn't rent again.

links_reviews_title: Very cute! I am 5 foot 6 and length was lower than model but made this better for office.
links_reviews_text: Wrinkles easily.

links_reviews_title: didn't end up wearing this dress, because it ran a little small
links_reviews_text: tight on the hips
This is a well-made, well-cut dress. It can be dressed down with flats for brunch or dressed up with heels for the office.
So many compliments and it was the perfect dress for a hot summer day
Happy I got this size since I've been getting larger sweaters during quarantine. The S is perfect since it keeps me just walking enough in the chill spring air. It's a really great cotton knit.
Snagged this sweater to wear on virtual calls while working from home. It's VERY bright. Very comfy and amazing quality!

links_reviews_title: Bright cozy sweater great for winter
links_reviews_text: This cozy sweater is very warm - would probably be too warm unless you experience true winter temps. I wore it around NYC on a chilly February weekend and was perfectly warm. Recommend for brightening up your look during the cold winter months! Definitely runs large/baggy and is very comfortable.

This is a thick cotton like others have said but it's still very warm and comfortable. It's a little oversized but I prefer that as I have some extra weight in my stomach. I loved the bright orange--wore it to pay homage to my alma mater.

A great sweater with a thick, heavy knit but it is listed incorrectly - this is 100% cotton NOT wool. It’s warm because of how thick it is but is not crazy warm or anything. It’s not itchy but it also has that cardboard-y cotton feel. It’s better than a synthetic but the quality is sturdy as opposed to luxurious. That said, it’s a gorgeous color, the knit pattern is classic but unique, and the elbow patches are a nice touch. The small gave me the roomy, oversized fit I wanted in a sweater like this - I’m sure the xs would have fit fine but I would stick with the small if renting again in the future. If you want it to look like it does on the model in the picture (who I would say is probably wearing a medium) I would suggest sizing up, while if you want a more streamlined look go with your usual size.
Perfect fit and the color is great! Love the patches on the sleeves. Very well made. Sweater is heavy it was perfect we had out first really cold day this week!
Wore this twice, I liked it so much - first with leggings, then with jeans. It's pretty boxy, but comfortable and cozy. Especially like the elbow pads.
Cute, loose fit sweater

links_reviews_title: Did not wear it. Was not flattering.
links_reviews_text: Did not wear it. Was not flattering.
I loved this sweater! I think the detail of it was great and it was a great to wear on a cold day.
I thought I'd maybe wear it once but ended up keeping it for 2 weeks. It's super warm, surprisingly attractive, and the color was gorgeous.

links_reviews_title: I literally considered buying this sweater.
links_reviews_text: It was ever so slightly oversized and PERFECT.
Love the orange and the feel of the sweater. It's not the itchy kind.

links_reviews_title: Great color, statement sweater to make winter pop
links_reviews_text: I was drawn to the great color of this sweater and it was just as vibrant in person. The cotton knit quality did not both me but it was a little rigid. The large elbow patches were annoying and made the sleeve more structures and hard to push up if warm. Overall nice sweater but elbow patches were not needed - to industrial.
Super comfy and roomy sweater that is 100% cotton so no itchiness. The color is beautiful and the elbow patches added a little something to the sweater.

links_reviews_title: Cozy and bright and pumpkin spice like
links_reviews_text: Super cozy, could have sized down to a medium but went with the large for my second trimester bump, was pretty roomy. Loved the color and design so warm and comfy would rent again
I loved this sweater. It was very warm and absolutely perfect for game day. The color is so vibrant and fun. I will definitely rent again!!!
Runs a little long, but the color and thick cotton weave are really nice

Great sweater to wear in the chilly fall weather. Definitely a thick weave but kept me warm. The color is bright and the elbow patch detail is so fun. I got a medium and it was very comfortable. I did wear a tank top underneath cause you could kind of see through some places but probably isn't necessary for all.

links_reviews_title: Super cute and comfy fall sweater. Great with jeans and boots.
links_reviews_text: Could have been itchy but it is not. Fits a little full. Perfectly fall.
Cozy sweater, and not too hot because it is cotton! Very bright and great for fall.

links_reviews_title: Great quality! I got a lot of compliments.
links_reviews_text: It was slightly oversized, but not enough to say it runs a size large.
Nice pop of color

links_reviews_title: It is comfortable and I love the color.
links_reviews_text: It fits perfectly. I like the length and it is not too oversized.
Perfect Fall sweater. Tons of compliments.
This sweater's color is magnificent and the detailing expert. It runs very large but I worry it as it fit my HS reunion colors perfectly!
I usually wear between 6-8
The best jeans I've worn. I might have to buy these babies! It fit me in the right places and so comfy too!
Fit great, loved the thick material, they were a little big and stretched more than some of my other re done jeans. But overall loved them.

These were super comfortable and cute. They have a good stretch which I did not expect. Also, they have a good real denim look. I went up a size after reading other comments and I wish I stayed with my normal size.
The fit was pretty perfect on these. There's a tad of stretch so if you're between sizes, go down because they will accommodate. Wasn't my favorite wash, but still wore them twice.

These jeans fit in all the right places. There's a button fly and touch of stretch to move around easily and sit, but otherwise I feel pretty buttoned in and they make my bum feel perky. I wouldn't spend 6 hours in an airplane in them, but fun every day jeans that are on trend with regards to the ankle length, slightly 90s wash and higher waist. I typically wear a size 4 or size 26/27 jean and I sized up given previous feedback. Not sure I'd be able to button the 26.

links_reviews_title: So flattering and looks great with many different style tops!
links_reviews_text: I LOVED these! This style normally doesn't work well for me because I am petite but I took a chance and am so glad I did! I received many compliments on them.
These had a little stretch but we a sexy fit. In love!
The pants looked awkward on me and the fit was just a tad snug.
Not a high waisted as I would have liked but they for great and the wash is classic. The button fly is a great detail.

links_reviews_title: nice jeans, rolled em up to mid calf
First time wearing this brand and was impressed.
links_reviews_text: Did not have any stretch, but all the same were very comfortable and I felt they formed to my shape quite nicely. Will try to rent more from this brand in the future. I am petite and the length was perfect with just a small cuff (but wasn't necessary).
I like the buttom up higher rise jean

links_reviews_title: Great Fit, kept my mom stomach tight and was very slimming. Wore it Kate Spade New York top
links_reviews_text: Loved the fit, cut, sizing.

These jeans are really well made and, when they fit, do not stretch out or become baggy. There is a slight give, so that they're not stiff though. That said, my first pair I loved so much that I didn't even return before renting a second pair. Thank goodness I didn't, because the second pair did not button past the second button (there are five) and was the same size. Given how much I love these jeans and the issues with fit, I ended up buying my first pair.

links_reviews_title: Great quality, but seem to run a little small.
links_reviews_text: Great quality, but seemed to run a little smaller in the waist. I am used to wearing Madewell jeans in this same size. However, I really liked the length. I'm 5'4 and the jeans hit right at my ankles.
These are a great fit and authentic wash. I am typically between a 26 and 27, and based on reviews, I ordered the 27 that fit great when I first put them on; we'll see if they stretch at all.

I think RTR programmed me for a size bigger than they should have, but after a few hours I was hitching these up! They were nice at first and then kept stretching until nothing at all was special about them.

These jeans are perfect for everyday around town. The denim is thicker, which holds everything in place nicely, but has a little give to it. They loosened up nicely, but haven't sagged after multiple wears. And I love the button fly!

A little longer than what I expected. Do take note they are button fly. Large prominent white brand label on the back. Not terribly flattering nor comfortable due to high waist/buttonfly/lack of stretch.

I'm usually a 27 or 28- a true size 6. I don't have narrow hips, so I ordered the 28 and I def wouldn't want them any snugger so go with your larger size if you waver! It's hard to button pants with a button fly since they are snug but these do stretch out a tiny bit with wear. I'm 5'3" and these come right above my ankles and look super cute with mules! Holding on to them for a bit :)
Love these. Nice cut and fabric feels expensive but still with a stretch.
These are definitely more fitted then my go to mother skinny jeans but very flattering

WOW! I've found my new fav jeans!!!! I think I wore these seriously 4 days in a row because I didn't want to take them off. That's how perfect they are! The denim is true cotton denim (read: nice weight) with the slightest bit of stretch to make these jeans fit like a glove. The button-fly waist is a total throw-back, but was easy to button. The jeans came up just over my belly button, so not too high. I wish these jeans came in a petite length because I wanted them to hit at my ankle (like on the model) but they were full length on me. I would have bought them in a heartbeat if they were shorter!
Wore these jeans a few times, very comfortable everyday jeans

I'm usually a 28, but these were a little tight. They most likely would've stretched out over time, but I didn't want to wait to wear them comfortably. They also hit me at an awkward length so if I bought them I would've gotten them hemmed.
Run small size one or two up
Too small, didn't wear. Great wash though!
Fit at waist. Very comfortable!

links_reviews_title: So many compliments, came new with tags!
links_reviews_text: Button fly, but easy to fasten and unfasten. Comfortable. Wore 3 times and it didn't look worn out or saggy.
Love these jeans! Perfect cut and denim wash. Great for everyday and can be dressed up for evenings as well
Everything about this was great. I would rent again.
Lovely silk shirt. The tie waist was really cute and the material was not too sheer. I wore it several times and wanted to keep it!

links_reviews_title: Cute, but low cut for work
links_reviews_text: I picked this top up from the store, planning to wear it to work. It was a little too low cut on its own for the office so I added a cami. I'm usually a medium/8 in tops and the 8 fit well. The tie at the waist is cute but the material keeps it from looking too casual. I noticed this print came in a dress too which I'll try when the weather gets a bit warmer this spring.

links_reviews_title: Cute but just a smidge tight
links_reviews_text: Cute but just a smidge tight
Beautiful floral pattern, cute tie in the front!
This fit well, and has a nice look and feel. There was nothing too special about it and the tie is a little awkward. overall a nice rental for work.

links_reviews_title: Rented to wear to work with slacks.
links_reviews_text: Very cute, but sheer, so it needs a cami underneath for work. The knot in the front makes is a bit more casual. It was slightly snug around my hips, making the longer back not fall correctly over my tush.
This is THE go anywhere blouse. Travels beautifully never wrinkles, and whatever you wear it with instantly looks super expensive. This name will go into my go-to rotation.
I love the print and the tie front strangely makes this top super flattering. Will order it again
This blouse was very pretty - goes well with black pants/jeans or blue. I found it large and a bit too full though the body. I preferred it tucked in, as the tie front did nothing for me.

links_reviews_title: Love these blazers. This is a little oversized
links_reviews_text: I wore a size 8, but typically I wear a size 6 in Veronica beard blazers. The size 8 was the only one available. I would have preferred a size 6. Loved the jacket and sleeve length.

links_reviews_title: Great blazer for work and for everyday wear
links_reviews_text: I loved this blazer, however, the price point is way too high for something like this as one of the buttons fell off after 3rd time I wore it... also, be aware that this blazer easily wrinkles.

links_reviews_title: One of my most favorite work rentals to date!
links_reviews_text: This blazer was such an amazing find! My size usually trades off between a 0 and 2, and though I rented the 0, definitely think the 2 would have fit too. The only thing I would say runs a little small with this blazer is the armpit area. This actually worked out fine for me since I chose to wear a thin, sleeveless top underneath. However, if you're also between two sizes and plan to wear this blazer with a thicker top (like a long-sleeved button up), it might be smarter to size up! This blazer made me feel so professional and confident at work, and I'd definitely want to rent it again. Would highly recommend!
Great fit and very professional - great for work
So comfy and so versatile. Got it to wear to work, but ended up also rocking it on the weekends and even to a baby shower. Love this piece might actually buy.

links_reviews_title: Such a great blazer to add some fun to work
links_reviews_text: Loved the longer length - the plaid was great too. I wore several times through the month of Feb. but think wearing in the spring/fall is definitely an option (can't be said about all plaids).

links_reviews_title: Really liked this blazer. Veronica is killing the blazer game

links_reviews_text: This fit well once I rolled up the arms a bit...I would have rather slouched them but couldn't get them to stick. It took me a bit to notice the latch on the front - it definitely looked better hooked but it came undone often. Was great for a day but wouldn't consider it for a permanent wardrobe addition.
Perfectly fitted blazer - was flattering and goes with staples in your closet. Would recommend sizing down if in between sizes

links_reviews_title: Love that this piece can go from day to night.
links_reviews_text: Slightly oversized fit but still flattering

links_reviews_title: Great for work and can be dressed up or down
links_reviews_text: Fit perfect and true to size

links_reviews_title: perfect amount of slouchy without being sloppy
links_reviews_text: Perfect amount of slouch. doesn't really close which i liked a little thin
Flattering fit. Part linen, so you get the nice feel of linen and wrinkles stay in the elbow crease. Wore a few times, would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Wonderful jacket to pair with jeans or a skirt.
links_reviews_text: Fit was wonderful, nice style!

Loved this blazer - true to size, except there is a zipper inside which I only could have zipped if I was about 5 sizes smaller so I'm not sure if this zipper is meant to be used, or if it's for keeping the blazer on a hanger? The zipper is not visible when wearing the blazer!

I loved this blazer and will rent again. I wore it to a conference where I was set to get headshots taken and also wore it on a vacation. Highly recommend! As far as blazers go, the fit was great. It was a bit tight in my shoulders, but I have broad shoulders so that isn't unusual. No stretch to it.

links_reviews_title: meant to stay open, does not close.
links_reviews_text: It's a short jacket that runs on the larger size. I need to reorder and size down.
Awesome Blazer! Lots of compliments at work, thought about buying it until I saw how expensive it is haha but will definitely rent again!

I probably should have ordered one size smaller, but I didn't know the brand, so I just wanted to be sure it would fit. It's a little oversized, but it's designed that way and it looks cool. I had trouble keeping the clasp closed, but I liked the open front look, so it wasn't a big deal.

links_reviews_title: Did not like the style on me
links_reviews_text: This jacket is a lot longer than it looks on the model. I am 5'2 so maybe that's why but the length was odd. The sleeves were an odd length too. I suspect that they are supposed to be three quarters length but on my short arms it looked like I was wearing a jacket a size too small. The button mechanism is also odd, it's a small silver hook and was not flattering on me. The print is cute and the fabric is good for late summer .
Love this jacket. Would purchase if not so expensive
Can be dressed up or down. It's a longer blazer, so it feels modern and youthful.
Usually take a 2 in veronica beard blazers, this ran large on me. I should have went with a 0. Print looked nicer on the photo
The dress is very loose and forgiving. It is lined with very soft fabric that makes it silky smooth

I love baggy big dresses, and this one was no exception. The deep V in the front and back helped to offset the lack of any figure-hugging. All that being said, it was still very large. I usually wear a 6 - 8 and still could have sized down. It kept wanting to fall off the shoulders which would actually be cute, if I wore a strapless bra and made it intentional. The material is beautiful and thick. This would be great to wear to a mellow steak dinner type place.

Wore for Christmas with the family. Only two downsides, first, if you have hips /curves, it won't sit the same way on you as the model - I found it looked best when tied right below my chest at the tops of my hips because if tied any lower it made me appear even boxier on top. The second downside is that it shows liquid very easily and takes forever to dry. I spilled some water on the end of the dress and there was a dark spot for several hours.
Rented this just for fun, and I loved it. It was so comfortable and once it is cinched, it's really flattering. I got so many compliments, and I could easily wear it to an event or just to work.

Loved this. Paired with a leather jacket and blocky heels for drinks and a show with friends. Best part? It has pockets! This piece is incredibly versatile. It arrived fairly wrinkled but I just used a handheld steamer, worked like a charm.
High quality fabric, beautiful colorful, glorified sack. This would look amazing on a tall straight body type, but defiantly adds volume to those with curves. You could order 2 sizes down.
I really enjoyed wearing this dress. The oversized fit might not be for everyone, but it is comfortable. The fabric is such a rich and pretty color. Perfect for a warm fall day.
Runs big. Small fit prefect. Needed a good iron on arrival. Good for tall. Pockets. Minimalistic modern. Love the color and fabric weight for early Fall. Compliments.
Easy fit and can adjust with the tie beautifully. Definitely runs bigger. Color and material is rich and feels fabulous.
Super easy to throw on, great thick material, could be dressed up or down. Wore to work and back to school night. Runs large- medium Worked but if rented again, I would get a small.

Beautiful color for fall and overall, a very comfortable dress. Ordered the M knowing it would have an oversized look, which was what I was going for, but I was swimming in it. You might want to size down, especially if you have narrow shoulders - you'll still have that oversized look but it won't be overwhelmingly so. Wore this to work so had to wear a cami under because the V was extremely deep and the neckline was too wide - it kept sliding down my shoulder. If I wore this to a social event, I'd probably go without a cami. The length was good - I'm about 5'4" and it hit right around my lower shin-area.

Love this dress so much I could cry. Poor quality photo I took does not give it justice. Just be aware it runs pretty large (I should have sized down one size) but even large it still worked. Planning on keeping for a while.

Wish I had sized down to a medium or even tried a small. This dress is huge, but I made it work by belting it. Loved the fabric, very cooling and expensive feeling. Neckline was super low for work so I wore a bralette underneath. Loved the pockets and the maxi length.

Usually its not my style, its why RTR so great to try for whole day or 2 to see yourself in something totally new- this is kimono, loose fit, can hide all you need & probably more, fabric is feels expensive, it did wrinkles some,& was not easy to iron ( i tried like silk setting- even its some type of synthetic). Color is very different from all your standards in the rainbow,its have pockets. Shoulders can sleep off, as back have deep cut too,& nit the best for running or walking far- as its narrow at the bottom & no slit, but i liked it - it was sophisticated look & very professional, or can be sexy too
This dress is great -- comfortable, great color, super easy. You can also adjust to either make low cut or not which I appreciate.

This dress definitely makes you feel like you're a creative who should be carrying tea and talking about auras Very nice material, runs a little large. A good work dress for when you're interested in a nontraditional silhouette.

links_reviews_title: Super heavy material and very long...
links_reviews_text: I think this is too much material for the shape. Very bag like.. I'm 5' 9" and felt swallowed up by the dress.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful fabric but size down multiple sizes.

links_reviews_text: Nice dress for casual every day wear.
I could have taken the medium but tuna true I think. Versatile and fun and felt kind of modern/retro. I wore with boots and sandals

links_reviews_title: Great Work Dress for Post-Work Event!
links_reviews_text: This dress was great! I should have sized down since the fit was large. The color was great and I received a ton of compliments that night!

links_reviews_title: You need curves for this, and I don't have them :(
links_reviews_text: I have narrow shoulders and am small up top, this wasn't flattering on me.

I think I could have loved this but it was SO big. I ordered a large as the mediums were sold out - I think a small would have worked... that's how much extra fabric there was. Color was beautiful and fabric was really nicely dense.

links_reviews_title: The most comfortable dress I have ever worn!! Absolutely love the color and fit.
links_reviews_text: Just had a baby and am still trying to lose the baby weight. This dress gave me a waist and a shape. Dont be discouraged when you take the dress out of the bag, it kind of resembles a potato sack but once I put it on I didnt want to take it off!!
Loved the somewhat unique fit. Baggy like a caftan but great cinched waist and low cut top.

links_reviews_title: Beautifully made dress but runs big!
links_reviews_text: Made it work with the belt tie, but order at least 1-2 sizes down.
I felt like a baby wrapped in swaddling find silks! This dress complimented the body even though it is not tight and everyone complimented it. I did not want to take off

links_reviews_title: Felt like a sister wife in this..
links_reviews_text: I had high hopes, and love the design, fabric and color of this dress, but it just did not work on me, I am not short, but this was so long on me that it ended up looking very dowdy and really not elegant of flattering. I was wearing it with flats, which might have added to the overall "sister wife" look, but maybe plan to size down on this one, I think its just so roomy and that combined with the length makes for a real dumpy look. Not my jam, unfortunately. Well made and really nice details, but nope.

links_reviews_title: Couldn't wear it out of the house - too big and unflattering
links_reviews_text: Very loose fit with too much fabric. Also too long, would have to wear heels
Made me look very hippy and wide

links_reviews_title: Fall Girl Cool / Not Hot Girl Summer!
links_reviews_text: Super chic, slouchy fit! Definitely loose, but I don't think that means it runs particularly big. If you're between sizes, go down though. It could overwhelm a small frame, but I loved the look! Quality was amazing & it draped beautifully! I wore a few times and would rent again.

I was happy this dress fit my bump given that it's not a "maternity" dress, but the cut and style just didn't look great with a belly. It looked like a fancy hospital gown, and the length was a little awkward for me too. Slightly too long to be a midi and too short to be maxi (I'm 5'5"). I wanted to love it, but maybe I'll try again post-baby.

This dress fit okay but was really baggy in the waist- which is okay if that's the look you want but I felt that it wasn't flattering on me (especially in the chest area, made the girls look saggy with all the extra fabric underneath). Returned without wearing.

links_reviews_title: Not for the short and stout
links_reviews_text: A lovely autumn color, but I would need to be at least a foot taller to pull off the amount of material and lack of shape. I think this is for willowy ladies, only.

I wanted to love it. I'm normally a 4 and ordered the small. It was HUGE so I waited to order the XS and it was still so overwhelming. I'm 5'3" and it was too long and the sleeves barely stayed up on my shoulders. I sent it right back.

Don't be fooled by this dress. When you first put it on it is a giant tarp, but the belt does wonders. I wore it in a bow knotted to the side once with pointed flats and once with white sneakers and both worked. Highly suggest sizing down because I'm 5'11 and it was still bigger than I'd like it to be. But I wore it to my works HQ in Paris and was told it looks elegant so It gets an A+ in my book.

Really loved this dress, I felt very cool and chic in it. If I rent again, I would definitely size down. The medium didn't look big, but my shoulders kept on falling down. So I think a small would help with that!

I WISH I could just buy this dress right now but I'll have to wait until it's been rented a few times. The flow and fabric of this dress is somehow magical?? Not to mention it's incredibly comfortable. Wore this on a Friday afternoon at the office and got a million compliments. I sized down because of reviews and it was the right choice!
This sweater was nice. It was comfy and fit well. It wasn't anything special though.
Comfy and not scratchy. The neck opening is a tad small and it is shorter, but other than that loved it! Wore with high waisted jeans and white tennis shoes for a comfier look.
Fun cropped sweater! Not too cropped I could wear with high waisted jeans. It's got weight to it, so it's warm! Colors are fun. Recommend renting

links_reviews_title: I'm busty and this short waisted sweater worked perfect with high rise jeans. Loved!

links_reviews_text: very short...almost like a crop top.
It's really short (but I'm tall). Super cute and fitted though.
fit a little tight and not a lot of stretch so i would size up next time
Great sweater to run around the city in.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous pop of color, cozy sweater
links_reviews_text: The fit was good, a little short in the length. Still workable but the difference between a 5 star and the 4 stars I gave it. Best part- super soft and cozy!

Wore this for our very casual family get together. I have a long torso so this hit me in a spot to make my legs look longer without showing midriff unless I was reaching up super high for something. My 4 yo daughter even made me a longer, chunky bead necklace to wear with it that ended up being really cute.

links_reviews_title: Loveeee! Great fabric and fit. Slimming. And hello—-pockets!
links_reviews_text: Slimming and pockets. Great print and great for day, date and more

links_reviews_title: NOT a shoulder bag. There is no strap. This is a clutch. Just FYI!
links_reviews_text: I thought this might have a strap enclosed but nope! It's a rather large clutch. Super cute, but not super practical. The name "shoulder bag" is very misleading :(
Cute and functional

This jacket immediately felt durable, thick and very warm. The pockets are super big and handy. Pockets everywhere! While this was cozy to wear, it is also bulky and felt "poofed" when driving. The range of motion isn't fantastic. Really high quality piece though!
Very warm! and cute, very bulky, but worked great for cold weather, and water wicking

cute jacket, but it was a little snug and sleeves were a bit short on me. i would size up if i got another one. plus the light pink gets dirty very easily, and the collar was a bit dirty already when i received. cool reversible feature though, and VERY warm.

This is the first piece I've rented and then actually bought! This jacket is super warm and has become my go-to winter jacket. I love how it's reversible and there's a lot of pockets. It is a puffy jacket so it's not the most flattering but I still love it anyway.

This is a new and super cute down feather bomber. It is VERY warm and hits right at the hips. I saw this in stores and got to wear it brand new! The color is a soft pink but not so much that it is too girly - it's a nice chic pink. The sizing is true to Lululemon and for me, I tend to have to size up from my usual 4 to size 6. I didn't see a sizde 6 jacket, so I went with this one. It was just slightly tight in the chest area, but it still fit fine. Would've been better if it were slightly looser though. So stick to your usual Lululemon sizing! I love that it is reversible! I wore it on the side with more cloth than the puffer material. Would recommend for sure!

I loved this coat. It was big on me, but it didn't really matter. It is pretty thin wool and 3/4 sleeves so it's not great for the coldest part of winter. Such a nice cut. Really special. Made me feel amazing.

so elegant! everyone asks if it's from italy. i was wearing it wrong for 2 weeks, but still so chic. you have to do the buttons. the wool cashmere blend hangs so well and never wrinkles, i even wore it as a giant scarf.

links_reviews_title: A beautiful piece that stands out!
links_reviews_text: This is a large cape like jacket in a felt material. It is light and not as warm as it looks. It photographs nicely and the layers lend it visual interest. The neutral colors make it easy to pair with anything. It makes everything you pair it with more upscale. This is a piece that can be worn many ways depending on how you button or unbutton it. You can size down if you want. I like the big look.
Great jacket! Fun to wear.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous and unique jacket. I got lots of compliments.
links_reviews_text: So fun and warm. Great for a shopping day or running around town. It's thin enough to wear in the car but warm enough to run in and out of stores.

This piece is truly incredible, brilliantly tailored, both modern and flattering. It is remarkably warm and soft for such a thin fabric. Not for the coldest New England days, but would work 75% of the time I think. The short sleeves are an amazing opportunity to show a cool sweater and are perfect with long leather gloves. My one criticism of the coat is that the internal button is a teeny bit too small so the coat slips open inside, but honestly it isn't a big deal because the way the coat is structured other buttons hold it closed. Not a deal breaker. One regret is that while the incredible design does allow it to be reversible, obviously one can't remove the internal tag on an RTR piece as one would on one's own clothes so I'm not sure it can really be worn reversed under these circumstances. Unless you really didn't mind the tag. Try this you will die for it.
Polished with a dash of starry fun for the work from home win! Felt comfy as a mumu without the frumpy look.
This waist was so unflattering on me, and it was see through at the bust

This dress leaves everything to the imagination, while some how leaving the wearer feeling sexy. The fabric is wonderfully stretchy and wrinkle resistant, and can go from pile on the closet floor to fab in under a minute.
Wore this with a black turtleneck underneath for warmth and because the chest was a bit sheer. Loved the comfy jersey material for running around the city on a Saturday. Very flattering and fun!

The best rental of the year. Made of a mesh-like material that was snug in all the right places. A unique but not overwhelming pattern and the perfect conservative length. Wore to a work event and got loads of compliments. Will be renting again and again and again.

links_reviews_title: Love this dress! Unique yet classy. Star print is so cute but subtle. Love how silly the fabric is
links_reviews_text: Great dress for work or weekend. Length is perfect for short girls!
Great fit and comfortable

I LOVED this dress. It's made in a more casual (almost athletic) fabric so it was super comfortable. I wore it to my casual graduation ceremony. I wear a small or a medium generally. The small fit but was just a touch tight. The medium was more comfortable overall in the arms and bust but there wasn't a huge difference in length between the two. The fabric is a bit thin, not crazy, but my mom told me I could've worn a slip with it so there's that. I would definitely recommend this dress! I wished I could keep it.

This cut works well on me. It's a beautiful stretchy star patterned fabric and tight fitting arms and across the chest but still conservative. And incredibly comfortable. I loved this for something different.

I liked it overall -- the pattern was great and it was stretchy and comfortable. The skirt was nice and swishy and at my height it was ankle length. Only thing I didn't like was that it was slightly sheer and looked a bit like a night gown if worn without a jacket.
Everything is right with this dress. Goes from work to nighttime perfectly, great material, swingy, form fitting in all the right places. UGH I want to buy it

links_reviews_title: So glad I wore a nude bra!
links_reviews_text: Stretchy, comfortable, nice swing to the skirt. Probably one of the most versatile rentals for me. Only note is that the fabric is thin so you need to wear nude undergarments.
Comfy and fun. Pretty thin fabric. The neck opening is tiny and I couldn't get my head through that easily though

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous pattern, loved the high neckline
links_reviews_text: This dress was so pretty, I liked the pattern of it and the movement of the skirt. It's fully stretchy so you could size down for a more fitted look.

links_reviews_title: Too short waisted for my liking
links_reviews_text: Love the idea and looks great on the taller framed model ...however I have curves and I just felt frumpy in this. It is a stretchy fabric, comfortable and a super cute concept but not on me. I didn't wear it.

This dress was ok. It's a stretchy material with no zippers. Everything fit fine, except the chest which was to small. The material stretched too much and became see through. I am busty so I wasn't that surprised. If your small on the bust then go true to size, busty size up. Also it was kind of frumpy on my curvy figure.

The fit is good and I love the design. One thing that I didn't like is the constant static cling. I wore this under a down coat, and it kept clinging on to my coat. It was good while it lasted. I'll probably rent again once the weather warms up.
Fits perfect, really easy to use.
Looked VERY weird on me without a belt, but then it looked really cute! Can definitely look a little matronly, but I think I made it work for the day.
Don't want to send back! The material is like butter, love this dress!
I rented this on a whim and was surprised at how much I liked it. The dress was comfortable, cool, and great for work. I will def rent again.

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much, I bought it!
links_reviews_text: Thin, stretch-material. Comfortable! Can be dressed up or down!

links_reviews_title: LOVE it. I love the stars and the cut of the dress. Is longer on me than expected, but looks great!
links_reviews_text: LOVE it. I love the stars and the cut of the dress. Is longer on me than expected, but looks great! Super comfy and stretchy fabric, just a beautiful dress.
Fashionable print & really nice silhouette, but not a very pleasant material - feels very synthetic & does not help with normal temperature control (it's very thin & somehow causes light sweat)

links_reviews_title: Transparent dress. And not in a cute way.
links_reviews_text: With tiny white stars on a deep navy background, this could be a fun dress—but the top is unintentionally see-through. I’m a size 14 with a 38D bra and the fabric sort of pulled and was see-through. Even for someone who sizes up this dress, be prepared to wear a tank under the dress.
Always love a good pair of Vince pants. The color is different in almost every light. Great rental, was able to get a lot of use out of them.

These leggings are amazing. They have an elastic waist band AND a zipper on the side. Comfortable to be leggings but dressy enough to wear as pants. For more work week looks follow @renttherunway_teacher on Instagram!
Felt more like pants. I had hoped that they would be tighter around the ankles. Nice forest green color

Stretchy waistband but tight on the legs. These are perfect for work and not too long for petites. I am 5' 2" and they hit me at the ankle. Beautiful color, not too bright green. Great to pair with a longer shirt since they are form-fitting. Definitely a good rental since I wouldn't want to spend this much on green pants.

links_reviews_title: Fits Great! No lumps or bumps!

links_reviews_text: I love these pants. The comfort of a legging but totally work appropriate. I am a true 29 and I rented a large instead of a medium since I'm early first trimester and I'm glad I did. I'm 5'5" with short legs but these still hit just above the ankle at a flattering length. I paired with an untucked oxford shirt and mules and it was an easy but polished look. I may purchase these!
Pretty color and nice material but super-tight stretchy material shows every bump. I'd suggest ordering a size up.

I should have read the description more closely as I thought they were pull on leggings, instead they have a zipper on the side of the pants. I detest side zippers and find them hard to get up and down. To make matters worse there was not even an eye hook or button at the time to assist you in pulling the zipper up, so I struggled and struggled. The pants fit true to size and were not tight, it was just difficult to get the zipper up. They are a fine legging with a bit of stretch but not too much stretch and a pretty teal color. I wore them with a longer sweater for work. The fabric is a bit light for winter and they hit me at the ankle and I am 5'2.
Good slim fit, a bit long
These pants are fantastic for travel. Their comfortable enough to wear on a plane, and they don't wrinkle at all in your suitcase.

links_reviews_title: Perfect work pants very comfortable and easy to move in.
links_reviews_text: Fit true to size hug you in all the right places a very comfortable fabric. They also are a great length they look good with boots and flats.
Absolutely obsessed with these pants- came so close to purchasing. They are super comfortable, flattering and stretchy.
Fit true to size

links_reviews_title: Beautiful material but not the right fit!
links_reviews_text: Loved the material but I'm 5'11 and these leggings were way too short on me. I'm also typically a size 4 and I definitely would need a medium on these - a little too tight! Love the festive color just not going to work for me.

Almost were long enough. I just needed 1.5 more inches shorter in the inseam for them to not touch the tips of my shoes. They have a notch in the back on the ankle, so you really wanna make sure you have then hit at the ankle bone or you'll look like you don't understand how clothes work. Other than that, they fit and were well made. Need longer legs. Sigh.
These fit perfectly - exactly what you'd expect from Vince. Although they're green, it's a very neutral color.

These Vince pants are high quality and very flattering. I thought they would be like leggings and I would have to wear a long shirt, but they were nice and thick and would be worn with a shorter shirt. The high waist looks nice and slimming, and the green color is gorgeous.

links_reviews_title: As with everything Vince - I love these leggings!
links_reviews_text: They actually fit more like pants but are perfect for work. The color green is versatile. The slit on the back ankle hem is terrific!
Fit perfectly. Very forgiving, but not too big in the waist, nor did they stretch out much during the day. Got a lot of compliments on the green color too.
The pants were too large despite me typically being a size XL. They slid down all day but overall were very comfy.
Love the dark green color. Really comfy
Rented this over holiday break. Cozy and goes with everything. Not bulky. Warm. Cute. Nondescript staple.
Ordered a size up than normal in hopes it would be oversized but it ended up fitting fine. It was cute, but a little itchy if you have sensitive skin to that this isn't the sweater for you
Wore this dress with a slip skirt and it was super comfortable and cute. Loved this sweater.
I loved the detailing on the sleeves of this one with the small cut out. The fabric was super soft and cozy. I would definitely rent this again.
I thought this was a cute, simple sweater that could be worn on the weekends or dressed up for work. Would order again.

I wore this sweater at least 3 times before sending it back! I wanted to keep it. It's a great classic sweater and is extremely comfortable! It's not too hot and could be dressed up or down. Definitely recommend!

links_reviews_title: So soft and the color has depth. Runs big
links_reviews_text: I would probably size down for the next time. It is very soft and has hints of very light gray/blue knit with the beautiful cream and taupe threads. Great detailing at the sleeve.

links_reviews_title: I was excited to get my choices delivered and could not wait to try them on
links_reviews_text: I didnt like the way this sweater fit. I usually wear longer tops and I felt this one did not get me a slim profile
Very soft, warm and comfy but it pilled a lot by the end of the day. It was also a bit more cropped than I expected and ended up looking a bit boxy with the oversized middle and form fitting sleeves.

links_reviews_title: This was a great comfortable and warm sweater, but you may want to retire it because it was pilled.
links_reviews_text: It fit well
Love this classic sweater, great for a chilly day in the office. Not see through at all.
oversized fit

links_reviews_title: 100% felt like a boss babe in this blazer
links_reviews_text: Great pattern and fit! Received tons of compliments on this blazer.

I rented this coat for a client meeting. It actually has a magenta/maroon color running through the plaid which was a nice surprise. I'm not sure if this piece has just been overworn, but it wasn't as structured as I would have liked. Still fit well (I sized down per other reviews) and was a pretty coat.
Loved this blazer!! It fit perfect and looks great paired with just about anything from a dress for work to jeans and a turtleneck for a casual look. Might buy this!
True to size! It fits me perfectly. I wore this to work, a holiday party, going out. It seriously goes with everything. I'm obsessed - might even buy it!
Arms a little long ( I cuffed them) but otherwise fit well and cute pattern
The pattern, fabric and pocket detail make this a nice change from a traditional black blazer. I wore it to the office with jeans and boots. Would love to keep it.

I reeeally want to buy this jacket, and totally would if it were $200 less. It is so amazing. I've never felt so confident before. I'm a size 4, but the size 2 fits me perfectly. There are so many different ways you could style this jacket. The fabric has some purple/maroon color woven throughout. It is gorgeous and makes me feel like a BOSS!

links_reviews_title: People need to wear this outside of work-- it's so cute!

links_reviews_text: So trendy and cute. Always receive tons of complements when I wear it.
Great jacket for in between seasons. Pairs well with jeans and black boots but you could dress it up for work or down for the weekend. Great fabrics that isn't too loud or busy. Love it!
The pocket detail gives it a unique look
Loved this jacket so cute with white turtleneck
Beautiful and comfortable coat!
Nice for work little big i would size down but overall nice blazer
Great blazer! Size down, I usually wear a 6 and the 4 fit. I'm pretty short so it's a bit long on me but it works. Greta for meetings, would definitely rent again
Fits TTS, maybe a little snug. I couldn't button it but didn't plan on it. Great length and flattering fit.
Nice, could be worn formally to work as a style piece or to dress up jeans

links_reviews_title: Cute casual blazer for dress down days at work
links_reviews_text: Blazer was cute and comfortable.
Fit well and good quality. Nothing memorable about it though.
I wore this with a basic white T tucked into straight jeans and loafers. It was a great casual but sophisticated look.
It ran very small. I would have need to order up two sizes and then the sleeves would have been too long It is very narrow

I wore this to work and to a professional conference. It's really high quality and fit my proportions perfectly. Tops and blazers tend to be too large on me in the shoulders, and this was perfect. I got tons of compliments, and I'll definitely rent this again.
Fit really well and true to size.
This piece is super cute for a lunch date with friends or just out and about paired with jeans. Great fit and quality!

links_reviews_title: This blazer looked very sharp for work; very chic and stylish.
links_reviews_text: Perfect for work or Happy Hour

I wore this a few times for work and a public speaking engagement. The fit was great, and I like the burgundy thread in the check fabric, but I didn't love the actual fabric. 2 issues: it pretty much stayed wrinkled. Even with a steamer it acted like linen. Also, it wasn't smooth to the tough. Almost like there are tiny threaded knots all over. I was happy with wearing it for a few weeks, but not beyond that.

links_reviews_title: wore it with all black black pants and blouse; worked nicely
links_reviews_text: It was smooth and worked well with all black outfit; it looked nice
trur fit

I loved the fit and print of this blazer from Joie - so high-quality, and kept me warm in my freezing cold office. I paired with a black sheath dress, black tights, and black booties - would also look great with jeans or skinny pants. I do think it runs true to size, but note that it's a boxy fit.

links_reviews_title: Fits great, looks professional and stylish
links_reviews_text: I've worn this about 5 times to work with jeans! Fits great, lightweight and flattering
LOVE LOVE LOVE. Very on trend - keeping another month - debating buying. Great for work, weekend, date night -

links_reviews_title: Felt professional, stylish, and smartly dressed.
links_reviews_text: Fit well, somewhat flattering while still being professional. Could have been better if it cinched in the waist, but it was perfect for what I needed. Also wore it to work and a conference, film festival panel, etc.

On the hanger, it doesn't look great, but I loved it once I put it on. Looked a bit frumpy and wrinkled on the hanger but it is quite a nice fit. I would say it fits true to size, the arms were just right. The overall shape is neither boxy nor super fitted. I wore it with cuffed light jeans, a white tshirt and neutral suede booties. WOuld have bought it if it wasn't only 10% off!

I'm not usually a big fan of plaid, but this blazer is great. The lining is luxurious, it fit me perfectly, I felt extremely polished and professional in it, and the pattern included both black and brown tones and looked appropriate with both black and brown shoes. I wish I could afford to buy it.
Good quality
Definitely a power blazer. Great length, but runs a bit large. I loved this and would rent again!
I wore this to a work convention. I loved the look and the fit. Definitely true to size. It was a little heavy and made me a bit warm during the convention but still a great blazer!

This is a very cute blazer good for work events. I got a 2 but kind of wish I went with 4 so had a little more room to move around, but it still worked nicely. Goes well with other more neutral colors (I did black pants and olive green pants).

links_reviews_title: Perfect work blazer. Paired with denim and a graphic tee
links_reviews_text: Perfect work blazer. Paired with denim and a graphic tee

This blazer is everything! I wore it to work with a black dress and deep red sandals that matched the color in the print of the blazer. I received SO many compliments! It fits so well, looks expensive, and is so comfortable! 100% would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Definitely one of my favorite pieces
links_reviews_text: It could easily be a staple in my closet. I regret not buying. Definitely will rent again
This is an easy to throw on jumpsuit. I'm petite and it fit but didn't really have much shape, but that's how it's supposed to fit I think.

links_reviews_title: Cute and casual, stretches a lot & bags out after all day wear
links_reviews_text: At first, it felt a little short in the crotch but it stretched a lot throughout the day. I thought it was super cute but I'm a little out of shape and the elastic kind of made the pudge between my arm and shoulder squish up and look obvious (you can see in the picture without a shirt). Someone in better shape should be fine. I tried a t-shirt underneath but the elastic made the fabric bunch. I wore a Madewell denim shirt tied up over it to solve this problem. I would probably wear it again but there are some other things I'd rather try first. Super comfortable and I thought it looked casually cute. I think you would need to clean it often to shrink up the fabric as it does get very loose.
I wore this to work, out on town, and on my couch as lounge wear. The shape is forgiving, but flattering. Also, loved the pockets and light material.
I wore this on my son's field trip with Chuck Taylor's and also dressed it up with a jacket and heels. Love it!
I have another romper from Madewell that I love. This one was a disappointment. Though that could simply be my dismay at the weight I have gained 45 days into lockdown.

links_reviews_title: Was nervous about this but ended up great!
links_reviews_text: Was nervous this would make me look like a potato, and it might have, but it didn't matter. Perfect for a beach vacation! Wore it out to dinner then on a boat the next day, super comfortable. It definitely stretches out and was a little tight when i first put it on but by the end of the night it had stretched to be a little more loose and comfortable!

These are so cute and fun. They're wonderfully loose and forgiving, and are great for running around town. The pants are slightly cropped to show just a tiny bit of ankle, and I wore JT without a shirt underneath. I'll rent this one again.

links_reviews_title: I absolutely love this jumpsuit. Great style and comfort.
links_reviews_text: Not for short girls. The crotch was halfway to my knees. I looked to see if there was a petite version but no luck. Big disappointment as this is one of the best items I have rented, despite poor fit.

I loved it, but it definitely does not give your body any shape, it almost looks like a ski suit. But I loved that. Enough baggy room in front to not cling to the belly. I wore it with a striped long sleeve shirt and camel-colored beanie. It was a big hit.

links_reviews_title: didn't like the fit on me
links_reviews_text: didn't like the fit on me
Perfect for petite individuals

When i opened the packaging on this piece, it looked like long pants with straps attached. There is not much shaping and there is an unflattering center seam running down the entire center of the body on front and back that is hard to see in photos. The pockets also do not help as they are very thick and add bulk to the hips. Material is not very soft and doesn't have much stretch. Big pass
Very itchy but did it's job and fit pretty try to size. Could be cuter with a belt but it's nice and simple !

I am 5 months pregnant and this was the perfect summer jumpsuit for my baby bump. I feel like if my bump gets bigger I can still wear it and I also want to wear it post-pregnancy. You can dress it up or wear it casually.
Super comfortable and forgiving, hard to find undergarments or shirts to wear with it. Looked best with a striped tee.

I read the reviews and I thought, how small could this romper really be...ITS NOT MEANT FOR REGULAR PEOPLE. This is the first item I have rented that is grossly mismarked. This is a petite romper and is very tight in the bust. if your short wasted and petite or 105 lbs and a AA, XS will work otherwise pick a different romper. I'm 5'4'' / 115lbs. with a 32B bust. I can wear almost anything xs/s -- but not this piece. :-(

I wore this jumpsuit all week! It is unbelievably comfortable and weirdly flattering given it is kind of shapeless! It kind of hangs off your body in an overalls way. The fabric is thick but not hot and the neckline allowed me to wear a normal bralette (though probably would have looked better with strapless). Loved this jumpsuit and am considering buying it!
I loved it but my family said it looked awful
It fit well. Upgraded my everyday look for running errands. It worked well for a first trimester growing midsection, disguising my midsection quite well.
This was a standard black jumpsuit, nothing special.
Hoped this would be "effortlessly chic", but it was lackluster. The fabric is actually quite thick (but feels nice), so wouldn't also be great for hot weather as I had intended.

links_reviews_title: Didn't wear this dress as the fit was really off.
links_reviews_text: I did not like the style of this jumpsuit. Once on it really didn't have any shape. The crotch was too low and the neckline didn't look very nice. Disappointed in this look.

This jumpsuit was a great fit. I'm 5'2" and the length was perfect, just to my ankles. It's a nice thick material and you can wear it with a regular bra. I topped it with the Zero + Maria Cornejo Edi Cardigan for the office and removed the jacket for post-work rooftop cocktails. CONS- The seams inside are coated with plastic and tend to be scratchy if you are walking or moving a lot. Would still be a good piece to wear for traveling.
Fit on top but gave kind of a drop crotch on the bottom

I wanted this to be loose and comfy, but it was tight around the hips where the pockets hit. I might order again and size up. The material is soft, thick, and stretchy. The length hit the ankles and I am 5'.
I loved the fit in the legs and the heavier denim was nice for the cold. They sent a 29 which was a bit bigger than anticipated, but true to size.
These jeans fit perfectly and were so comfy

These jeans were great! They had a nice stretch to them so they were extremely comfortable to wear all day long. They make the rear look great too! The light wash went well with everything. I would rent these again in a heartbeat!
I loved this denim--just the right amount of stretch!
High waist. Fit well in thigh and leg, little loose in waist but overall good fit.

links_reviews_title: Structured yet soft, and doesnt stretch out!
links_reviews_text: These fit great all day long. The wash was lighter than pictured and lighter than I prefer, but the stretch and structure are fantastic.

links_reviews_title: Super stretchy and comfortable to wear! Not terribly long either.
links_reviews_text: For it not being a petite size, it surprisingly wasn’t horribly long on me. Fit like a glove!

Madewell are historically my favorite denim brand for their perfect fit, stretchy material, and overall comfort. This lattice pair are the perfect medium wash with a slightly distressed look at the ankle. I love the high waisted fit and the length of the jeans. I wore them on a 8 hour flight and was perfectly comfortable the entire time. Definably the most comfortable pair of pants I've ever worn.
These jeans have an amazing stretch and hit right at your waist. I'd order a size down next time as they have a lot of stretch to them.

links_reviews_title: I love these! They run a tad bid.
links_reviews_text: These jeans are great! I'm usually a 27/28, and I could probably squeeze into a 26. I'd definitely rent these again.
