I loved these jeans! I got them in size 30 and probably could've sized down to 28 because they do get a little loose after wearing them all day. The material is nice and thick, but they're super stretchy and comfortable. Loved loved loved these jeans.
I love all madewell jeans and these are no exception. They're super soft, comfortable, and flattering. They have the perfect amount of stretch. Debating buying these for sure!
Photos on the model are very true to fit. Stretchy/soft jean material made them very comfortable
These jeans have just the right amount of stretch to be comfortable for all day wear and are a really nice color.

These are a perfect pair of high wasted jeans. The only thing is that since there is a slight stretch, it kind of layed on me rather than sucked me on. But other than that, nice pair of jeans and hit me a cm above my ankle!
Soft, snug and comfy.
So obsessed! Wish I had bought them!
Fit me perfectly, super comfy, nice midweight denim with structure.

links_reviews_title: Helped deciding which size jeans at Madewell to buy next
links_reviews_text: Comfy fit high waisted
I see why madewell is known for their jeans.
Loved the fit and the high waist was really flattering
Super cute and fit similar to other Madewell jeans.
God I love these. They just fit right. Honestly I think you can size one size up or down. I've rented the 29 the 30 and 31 and I think they all fit pretty much the same.

links_reviews_title: I didn't rent these for a specific event.
links_reviews_text: Renting these Madewell jeans was a great way to test drive them. I loved the quality and fit and will likely purchase a pair.

links_reviews_title: Cool jeans, but waist was so big!
links_reviews_text: fit everywhere but the waste- order a size smaller
Very comfortable and high waisted with just enough stretch. My only con is that I'm 5'8" and the bottom came a little short.
Ok, ladies. These are the best jeans I have ever worn. Like an angel's hug.
This sweater is very heavy! Which was great for Chicago. It has a oversized fit. Overall super warm.
Cozy and thick but a little frumpy because it isn't form fitting at all. Nice if you're hiding a muffin top! Good sweater, wouldn't buy it though.
XS is great fit for me

I LOVED this sweater! The sweater is oversized but the fit is flattering. It's thick it was perfect for a fall day in Boston. I'm usually an 8/medium and the medium fit well. Will definitely rent again while the weather is cool. Highly recommend!

links_reviews_title: SO WARM but a little mature for my style
links_reviews_text: This sweater is SO THICK AND WARM. Love the colors and the pattern, and it isn't itchy! (I am very picky with itchy sweaters). Ran a little big - I'm usually a S and the XS was perfect. However, I felt like the style was a little older/more mature than what I usually go for. Felt a little like a soccer mom (but in winter) in this look.
Warm and comfy! Prefect for winters in Chicago. TTS, I tucked it in.

LOVED this sweater. Beautiful colors and thick and warm - almost too warm. Would not recommend for anything over than 30 degree weather (or below). Sleeves were long but liked it that way, even rolled them up at some times during the work day. Would def rent again!

links_reviews_title: Not as bright as the picture but nice everyday piece
links_reviews_text: Definitely more of a deeper color than what's pictured on the model. The sweater is nice and warm. I enjoyed it but seemed like an everyday sweater. Nothing truly special about it.
Very warm, cozy sweater. Received many compliments!
LOVE this sweater as it was the perfect cozy chic vibe I was going for. It was super flattering and eye catching as well, a ton of compliments on this one!

This sweater may have worked if I weren't 5 months pregnant. Its oversized style made me look like a cozy apple. It is beautifully made and truly warm. I could feel the heat being trapped between my bare arms and the material, which felt so nice. The color is more apple/candy red than the pictures show. It's not an orange red. Really pretty, just not for me. This is an XL and I'm 5'10".

links_reviews_title: Cozy sweater that brightened my day!
links_reviews_text: Really cute and cozy! The material was surprisingly soft when I was worried it'd be itchy. It fit great but was a little snug for my love of oversized sweaters. It was a fun twist on a turtleneck and the colors were super cute

This sweater might be the coziest thing I've ever worn. I usually don't go for turtlenecks, but this one actually worked pretty well for me! The knit is very thick, so it's both cozy and concealing - not a tight fitting piece at all.
Really cute sweater. It check all the boxes: comfy, cute and warm. Was perfect for a chilly October day in Sleepy Hollow.

I liked this sweater a lot. The fabric and color were absolutely beautiful. The fit was fairly oversized, but the slit on the sides made it somewhat more flattering. It was still pretty bulky, and the sleeves were very long, but it's meant to be relaxed.

I love bright colors for fall and this sweater did not disappoint! I wore it to my sorority's fall retreat and out on a dinner date a few days later! It's a bit oversize, but the small fit me perfectly. The quality was amazing, and I just felt so cozy every time I put it on!

This sweater is awesome! It is pretty heavy-weight but in no way did it feel restricting or uncomfortable. I loved the slit on the bottom - it really helped to bring shape to the garment so it looked flattering. Pair with jeans, cute booties and some gold jewlery for a very of-the-moment casual chic look.
Super warm with a snug fit, and most importantly it wasn't itchy. Only problem for me it it felt overwhelming at the neck and the red tone wasn't super flattering with my complexion.
The color of this sweater is incredible. It's also warm without being super hot, and thick without being overwhelming. I would highly recommend this to everyone!
I love this
Loved the heavier weight of this and long enough to be worn with leggings even for tall girls like myself. This has warmth without being itchy!
It was super boxy and bulky, not in a cute oversize way.

links_reviews_title: Bulky and itchy. Not a look for office, maybe cold winter weekend day.
links_reviews_text: Itchy Bulky Adds weight, not flattering

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a college visit with eighteen of my favorite ninth graders...
links_reviews_text: ...a kid's older brother, and two generous alumni. This merino wool sweater is double thick, soft, and gorgeous. I sized up-up to be able to wear it over a couple of layers, wore it over jeans with a wool cap and gloves, and was snug despite temperatures in the thirties. Easy. Cozy. Tidy. Fun enough to throw on under a long wool jacket for dinner, and unexpectedly versatile enough for a thirty six hour trip to New England.

links_reviews_title: I didn't love it as much as I wanted too.
links_reviews_text: Material a lot heavier than expected.

links_reviews_title: I work from home so always just like to wear comfy, cozy clothes that are also stylish!
links_reviews_text: Cozy, thick sweater! Definitely warm. Just didn't LOVE the style of it. Wish it would have been longer and maybe more of an oversized fit. It would be great for a ski trip or cozied up in the mountains though.

links_reviews_title: Cute, not as baggy as picture
links_reviews_text: The material of this sweater is REALLY nice. It's thick and warm so you can tell it is a quality sweater. I really liked the sweater overall, my only negative is that it wasn't as baggy as the pictures. The XS fit perfectly, but it was a fitted sweater - I would recommend sizing up if you want the looser look.
Absolutely love this sweater! Worked perfect with an almost 30wk bump and I was able to wear my normal size. Very flattering fit!

I was hoping for a cozy sweater to wear with leggings and this wasn't it. It's a lot shorter than it appears on the model (and I'm only 5'2") so it's not really a leggings sweater. Also, the neck was VERY constricting. I returned it without wearing. Maybe the XL would have been better.

This is just a gorgeous sweater. There's more subtle color going on than is apparent in the picture. I am always cold, but not with this! My only complaint is that the sleeves were too long on my short arms, but it's a sweater so I rolled them up.
This is a very cute sweatshirt but runs large so when you rent, make sure to go a size down.
Nice color and material, but nothing special.
Wore it to my family thanksgiving. It was a little scratchy but fit well.
Fits well, sleeves a little too long for my liking. Good style and nice and warm for a cold day I usually wear a large and this is XXL and was the size suggested and it fits.
True to style, warm and bright. Loved it!
Love this heavy knit sweater (have rented same sweater in blues previously). Very heavy and warm. Great vibrant colors.
I loved the fit, warmth and details of this simple, but unique sweater. Flattering cut and length.
Tight
Wore this on the chilliest day in NYC. I was so warm and I don't usually wear things this bright so it was fun to mix it up.

links_reviews_title: Period stains and runs super small
links_reviews_text: Period stains in the crotch. Also runs super small. Beyond disappointed and disgusted.
These leggings are pure butter and fit like a glove. I wore them 3 separate times. They are slimming, cute and so smooth!!!

links_reviews_title: Nice but not for an intense workout
links_reviews_text: Very soft and comfortable but not very supportive. They also showed a little sweat after my workout. These would be best for brunch, running errands or a light workout. Very soft but I prefer my leggings to feel like they're really holding me in while I work out.

I loved the pattern and fabric of these leggings! I wore them to run errands and go on a bike ride on the weekend. When they arrived to me, the drawstring on the inside was tied in a knot I couldn't untie, but I tried them on anyways. That's when I realized that the knot was there because these leggings would not have stayed up other wise. Strangely unsupportive at the waist, but I guess that's why the drawstring was there! Wouldn't rent this pair again, but would maybe size down to a 6 for any other leggings from this brand.

links_reviews_title: Perfect fit, cute as a button
links_reviews_text: High waist definitely kept me sucked in and i loved the color pattern! True to size I would say and even better, the legs weren't long so they didn't bunch up...they hit right at my ankle which is a win!

First time wearing lululemon. Glad I could test them out before buying in store. I'm 5'4 with short legs, and the 25' hit about 2in above my ankle. There's also no seam at the ankle, which makes it very comfortable (no seam lines!) , but also makes it look like they were cut/unfinished. Not sure how I feel about that. Either way, the leggings are buttery soft and I love the fit. Would opt for a longer length next time.

So comfortable and a unique pattern. Probably could have fit into the 6 but the 8 fit well and stayed put without making me self-conscious. Glad I got to try these, now I know a purchase would be worth it.

links_reviews_title: Great break from my solid colored leggings
links_reviews_text: Great fit, so soft, gorgeous colors
So comfy and flattering

I would never have bought any leggings this expensive, so it was great to try them during my 1 month of RTR Unlimited. They fit perfectly, came up high enough, weren't see through, and had nice pockets!

links_reviews_title: Great shape and super work jacket
links_reviews_text: Loved the fabric and front tie style jacket. Gave a nice style to grey slacks or Jeans. 42 was a bit large on my 5'2" frame but didn't feel overwhelmed. Would go down a size and I'm curvy

This was my mistake - I didn't read the description carefully. The material is not anything close to a sweater, it's polyester. The jacket fit fine, but was too long for my taste (as a blazer, anyway). A size down might've been better.
Great fit and style!

This jacket was good for travel because it was versatile and didn't wrinkle. That said, the tie is weird. I don't think there was enough room for the front lapels to overlap. That meant the jacket didn't lie smoothly when tied at the front. I tried to tie the ties at the back but that was really uncomfortable to sit back against. Wouldn't rent again. Perhaps better for a straight or apple body?

Comfortable but overall effect was a little frumpy. I originally ordered the size 54 which was definitely too big. When I got the size 52, it fit better in the waist but was still pretty loose on top for me. The sleeves are long and the shoulders are a little wide. It would be nice if it didn't have to be tied closed all the time, but that's pretty much the only way it worked for me to wear it because of how the belt loops are positioned. It's a great neutral color for spring and summer and a nice layering option, but I'm not sure I'll hold on to it for much longer.

Love this jacket! It's an easy fit and looks very smart. It has these great easy pockets too. The fabric is comfortable but unfortunately, there's puckering on some of the seams. Overall, I would want to keep this item

links_reviews_title: Arms were way too long for me to wear
links_reviews_text: Arms were way too long for me to wear

links_reviews_title: This jacket goes with everything, and is a class act finish from work to casual!
links_reviews_text: No buttons, only a belt closure-good and bad.
I may have gotten a far too big size but this was just too much fabric to wear as a blazer. Could have been cute as a fall jacket / outerwear
It was huge. I don't know if I'd be willing to try it 1-2 sizes down. It's not worth the hassle.
I rented this for everyday wear. It looked cute on the model but not on me. The collar sat weird and I didn't like how it looked around my midsection. But I would say it's true to size.

I didnt end up wearing this, and I actually had rented it before. Its honestly just kind of boring and boxy, however, my daughter did wear it to a dinner, and it looked really great on her. Nice lightweight jacket on her. On me.. bland and lumpy looking. Glad she got to wear it! HOpefully I dont forget and rent it again.. haha
This jacket is so much worse in person than it looks online! The fabric feels cheap - maybe worn too much - and fit is so awkward and ugly.
This runs really large and all the fabric was just totally unflattering on my body. I have a bigger chest and this just ended up tenting on me.
this jacket was bulky and the bottom looked droopy based on the combination of the large pockets and tie belt. Also the sleeves are very long.
I definitely could've sized down, it was too big on me in the waist, arms, and shoulders
I was hoping for more pizzazz but this is a basic navy jacket. I sized down per the other reviews and I am glad I did. The size 40 seems a bit worn out so I never actually used it.
Loved the fit and look of this jacket. I usually don't wear a belted jacket or sweater but this worked really well to dress up skinny jeans at work
Gaps in front and was not flattering on me.

This jacket runs large in the arm length and width. It needs to be belted or it would be too long. It’s a nice looking jacket otherwise. It would be good for work or over a dress in a cooler setting. It’s not lined, so don’t leave it open or expect it to be warm.

links_reviews_title: Love it. Adds just enough dress to a casual pair of pants.
links_reviews_text: Belted jacket that is perfect for cool fall days.
This piece can be dressed up or down and is light enough to wear with a shirt underneath. The sizing was great except for the sleeves which were must too long for the size and had to be rolled up.
This jacket works well with casual or dressed up work clothes
Very big in shoulders and arms.

links_reviews_title: The 48 great and I got lots of compliments. The 50 was too big and didn't come with the belt...
links_reviews_text: The 48 was a great fit. The 50 was a bit too baggy and it didn't come with the belt.
This jacket is not tailored. The pockets and shapless fit made me think of a painters smock. I returned without wearing this item.

links_reviews_title: nice - fits well and looks trendy
links_reviews_text: fits great, fabric is so-so, great color and style
loved the pockets

links_reviews_title: Fall is here so I had fun accessorizing this for the new season.
links_reviews_text: The jacket fits as expected. The arms are a little tight with a shirt underneath them but I have larger arms than most people. It closes over my ample bosom just fine and is a nice navy color. I wore this with a light scarf and pants with a mock turtleneck underneath. Something about the look just isn't crisp, however, which throws me a bit. I also find the length is good untied but when I tie the jacket, the placement of the slit in the back makes it bunch at my rear end, which isn't flattering. Not a bad piece, just not my favorite.

This jacket engulfed me. It was just so large and overpowering. Plus, the hem was unraveling, and it just looked awful. There was no way I could wear it anywhere. I was very disappointed in this rental.

links_reviews_title: Rented this for the office. Too baggy and unstructured but would be great for fall with jeans.
links_reviews_text: Fit well, just too casual for the office.
Too large

links_reviews_title: It's very nice fabric and cut
links_reviews_text: I like the color and the cut. Very nice

links_reviews_title: Love this jacket great for work and stylish
links_reviews_text: Fit great!
Runs very large. Cute but couldn't wear.

links_reviews_title: Designer fit. You can tell from a mile away that the cut is excellent.
links_reviews_text: Improves any outfit. Better on than on the hanger.

links_reviews_title: Just to hot for the season
links_reviews_text: I liked it but not right for the season it was heavy material

links_reviews_title: It’s a nice style and keeps you warm.
links_reviews_text: It’s too big long sleeves. I had to roll up the sleeves.
A little too formal

The material is comfortable and has a little give while still being fairly structured. The pockets are actually double layered with one entry from the top and one from the side. Cool. Looked good with skinny-ish slacks, but I bet it would go with a wide leg pant too. The sleeves are very long (notice on model). I have long arms for my size and they fit as pictured on the model. The material isn't really good for scrunching up the sleeves though. I'd maybe rent again in a pinch.
Loved these oversized joggers. Trendy and comfortable. I sized down and they were perfect. Still had the baggy look on the top but fit great in the waist. Will rent again.
The vertical black line down the side is so flattering and really elongates your legs-- only negative is the pants run a little big. I would recommend sizing down to get a more fitted look

I rented these for work. They run big. I usually wear a 2 in pants and I ordered the 0 - and that was the right call. The pants are really cute, made of nice material and have a nice jogger cuff with an open slit. However, the style just isn't for me. I really like how these look on other reviewers, just not on me.
Sized down based on other reviews and glad I did as the fit was still a bit baggy, but overall still cute! Mostly was baggy in the crotch area.
I love taking a risk with rentals and this pattern was great. The waist fit well but the legs and ankles were baggy and didn't hold their shape. I expected a "jogger " to be tighter at the cuffs
The side detail is great. I have wide hips and smaller waist and they worked well. I wore them with sneakers. The high waisted fit was exactly what I wanted
Runs large so size down

I normally wear size 4 in pants (or 27-28) but I took note of other reviews and ordered 2 sizes down. I really liked the pants a lot, they were still a bit baggy/loose but tailored, so you can wear them to the office. They fit at my natural waist perfectly (27" most of the time) and were pretty flattering on my bum. The ONLY thing I wish was different is the length - I'm tall so these were a bit too short on me. The cuffs came up to my calves so the split on the cuff looked a little weird, they didn't look as tailored and fitted on the bottom as I'd like. You can see it in the pic. But other than that if you order a size or two down they could be great.
These joggers are sophisticated, comfortable and look great. Received so many compliments on them.

I get that these are joggers but they run possibly two sizes large. So seriously size down at least one likely two sizes, they'll still be loose. Promise. Otherwise I like the pattern and thicker fabric. I looked a little silly like I was swimming in my pants but I imagine with the right size they would be a fun pant for work or play.
They are baggy and run big. I usually wear a 4-6 and I wore a size 2. Really baggy in the bum. Made it look like my butt fell off.
These are cute but run pretty big and are really high waisted.
Yeah, these run a little large and baggy but if you're into menswear these are really cool. I got a ton of compliments on these at work.

I sized down after reading the other reviews, and I think it was the right move. Perfect fit at the waist but loose in the butt and hips for a baggy but dressy look. Lots of compliments from my female coworkers, though my kids did not like them! :)

links_reviews_title: They're joggers - they're supposed to be loose!
links_reviews_text: Based on the other reviews I ordered one size down, and even then they were a little loose. Which was great, because they're joggers! They sat low on my hips and were baggy through the crotch and legs. I wore them twice: once casually with a sweatshirt and sneakers and once a little dressed up for a meeting with booties and a blouse. I have to say they looked better worn casually. I think trying to dress them up like the model makes them feel a little off, like they're trying to be slacks, but that's just me.
Take the leap and try these joggers! They were very different and fun! Previous reviewers were correct, I sized down and they worked out well.
Loved these! I'm kind of short so I cuffed the bottoms and they were big but a belt did the trick

Great look to these pants. Different style than everyday black work pants. Slit on bottom ensure elastic is not too tight around ankles. They did run big in the waist and a little longer than I would've wanted. Will rent again in a smaller size to see if they fit better
I really liked the style and quality but these trousers were huge. As someone who is typically a 2-4 I got the 4 they were really baggy and gave me no shape. Should have gone with the 2.
Loose fit.
I made it work, but it was a little long on my legs
Really large in the tummy area. The piping and cuffs on the bottom are unique and i loved them. It's men's wear without taking out the space in the front...
horrible fit but it could just be wrong size

These pants are cute and comfortable, but they run HUGE in the crotch area. They fit me ok at the waist, but it seemed like they would fit someone with a longer torso better than me. They were also super roomy in the thighs. I wish they were more of a slim fit and I would have really loved them!

I have a small waist and big thighs/butt and these were so comfortable, I always have issues finding pants that fit over my hips. I am 5'6" very curvy like 165lbs and these fit nice. Kinda snug in the waist, it has no stretch in the waist band but there is stretch in the legs. I wore a body knit sweater over it, and black booties for work

I will agree with the other reviewers that I believe the sizing runs large, even for these being joggers and they are meant to be slightly loose/baggy. However, I did love the overall look/fit. They were super comfy to wear for work, yet still looked polished.
Just not my style. Too boyish and baggy. Sizing down would not have helped.

links_reviews_title: Too big but would be very cute in right size
links_reviews_text: It ran big so it was loose in the butt all the way down to my ankles. It is a pant that should be worn tight given the style/cut
Pants were very baggy with lots of room in crotch area. Needed to size down a lot. I usually were 2/4 in pants and the 2 was big! Did not wear

I sized up based on some reviews and these were huge on me, I couldn't wear them. I would suggest sizing down if you're between sizes. These also may not be great for short people- the crotch part of the pant sat really low on me. Maybe that wouldn't have been an issue in a smaller size.
These fit a little bigger than I expected. They weren't flattering on my shape (slightly curvy).

links_reviews_title: Pants. Can't live with them, can't live without 'em.
links_reviews_text: Ok so I'm 5'3" and an apple figure. These were a little light around my waist but baggy elsewhere and slightly long but because it's tapered, still very flattering. I wore this with a longer, baggier sweater and it was cute (albeit slightly uncomfortable). Here's to you for taking the chance on renting a pair of pants on the internet!
Worst retal yet! There's baggie pants and then there's this. Too much fabric everywhere. Not flattering nor cute.

links_reviews_title: Comfy, yet classy enough for work. The best of both worlds.
links_reviews_text: Comfy, yet classy enough for work. The best of both worlds. Had to iron it before wearing as it was rather wrinkly when received.
Agree with other reviews that the fit here is awkward, creating a baggy backside. Cute style, great idea but execution not quite there. I'm usually a 4 or 6 and the 2 was still big

links_reviews_title: Huge! Sizing down is a must
links_reviews_text: It was way to big to wear, I'm normally a 6-8 with huge hips. I'll probably rent this again in a size 4
Was large fit and had no stretch. Looked like I was wearing someone else's pants so i did not wear them for work

links_reviews_title: These run big! Size done one size...
links_reviews_text: These are loose cut anyhow but ran very large for me. I suggest sizing down one size if your have a small waste vs hips and two sizes if you're pretty staring down.
I. Love. These. Based on other reviews I went with the size 2 and it was a perfect fit! If the weather weren't warming up I'd keep these to wear a few more times.
Easy to match, comfortable, classic looking necklace. Perfect for a date or work (for a video conference).

I thought this would be great to jazz up a basic shirt for work but it is really big. It would be a little too eye-catching and overwhelming in an office environment. I'd definitely rent it again for a dressy event, it would be great with an LBD.

links_reviews_title: Great for work or dressing up a casual outfit
links_reviews_text: I wore this jacket out and at work. I loved the sharp shoulders and tailored feel. True to size.

links_reviews_title: Fun spin on your everyday blazer
links_reviews_text: Overall I really liked this jacket. The embellishments are great and really make your look unique. The sleeves were VERY long compared to the rest but overall I liked this jacket!

This was a nice solid jacket. However, on the size 4 I rented, it seems the fabric was pulling away from the liner, sort of wrinkling and pooling. Maybe it needs to be retired?? Anyway, at 5'8", sometimes sleeves are too short. But these were actually slightly long. Not so much that I didn't enjoy wearing it though. It has nice military details, is higher in the back, sort of dips in the front. It's darling.

links_reviews_title: I wore this to work. Felt very Rhythm Nation. Loved it!

links_reviews_text: Runs large but is a great staple for work. Would order smaller size. Has a cool 'rhythm nation / Janet Jackson vibe'! Paired with shirt and pants and over dress.
This gives a different twist to the black blazer. Can be worn over so many things, pants, dresses, skirts, etc. loved it

Rented this for a work conference, paired great for a casual evening event with a blouse and skinny jeans. It's more fun than the classic black blazer and has a very flattering cut. The sleeves are long as other reviewers mentioned but not so much that I wouldn't rent again. Overall nice rental, will probably rent again for a similar event.
As others have said--good jacket, sleeves a little long, and it was a touch big on me.

It is a great style and very flattering but I am not sure what wingspan the designer things most women have - I am tall with long arms and the sleeves still came all the way over my hands! I had to roll up the sleeves.

links_reviews_title: Great military blazer but a bit too long in the sleeve
links_reviews_text: Impaired this blazer with jeans, a white blouse and chunky necklace. Received many compliments. My only complaint was the sleeve length and I would have liked if there were buttons or hooks down the whole blazer and not only at the top. Overall a great look!

links_reviews_title: So soft and looks great! Love it!
links_reviews_text: The fabric is amazing on this jacket! I am considering buying it.. Looks and feels fabulous! The sleeves were a tad bit long for me but I just turned them over once to make it work.
Fits true to size but sleeves a little longer than expected. Cuffed and worked great!

links_reviews_title: Loved this one. Great fit, style
links_reviews_text: Spot on. Would buy but too pricey.
Wore this over a dress for a work event and it turned a simple dress into professional attire!

links_reviews_title: I loved the idea of this jacket, but it is not flattering to my shaped-like-a-personable-sea-otter.
links_reviews_text: Beautiful fabric

links_reviews_title: Tall Ladies beware...this is bolero length
links_reviews_text: The jacket is just okay. The material is more Spring/Summer weight than I had imagined. The length is much shorter than the model is wearing it. Not what I was looking for.

links_reviews_title: Super cute. easy fit, easy to wear. just enough "military" to it to look great with skinny jeans
links_reviews_text: Very true to size. Looked great with dark skinny jeans, patent leather heels and the pop of pearls. Many compliments!
Fits true to size, pairs well with work dresses, fun and out of my normal realm of blazers.
Cute but not my style

links_reviews_title: Cute but sleeves were too long
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to love this as I desperately need a versatile but not boring black blazer. Unfortunately the sleeves are just too long and because of the fabric, folding the sleeves just doesn't work. Sadly will be returning after just one wear.

links_reviews_title: sleeves are way too long. Jacket is cute but bad fit for me.
links_reviews_text: style is cute

links_reviews_title: This was stylish and fit very well
links_reviews_text: Loved this!
Super cute jacket, but unfortunately was too big for me so had to return

links_reviews_title: Really great casual alternative to a blazer. The fit is wider in front & narrower in back.
links_reviews_text: The sleeves are a bit long and the fit runs just a tad too large--but nothing too detrimental! Just not as tailored as I was expecting.
Good details.

links_reviews_title: didn't love the big shoulder pads.
links_reviews_text: too big for a smaller frame

links_reviews_title: I wore this jacket to work and out to temple and got a few compliments. Would def. rent it again!
links_reviews_text: I love the shape and style of this jacket. Is a little funky and sassy and is fun for work or for going out.
Loved this piece, and kept it for a few extra weeks. Very flattering and versatile.

I loved this blazer! It's very chic and stylish, and depending on what you pair it with can look edgy (leather leggings and heals). I wore it for a work event and to high holiday services. I had a little trouble finding the right top to wear under it because the cut is short. I ended up wearing a much longer black shirt underneath.
Sleeve are too long. Could be cute if you get a size smaller than normal.
It fit perfectly; very flattering.

comfortable, but the shoulder pads are a bit strange and protrude from tbe side of the shoulders a bit. They look lumpy. But otherwise a really nice jacket that is both comfortable and trendy, and not to heavy or bulky.
Was a little big on me, one size smaller would be perfect.
Arms are very long and there aren't any pockets- otherwise a great work blazer
Sleeves were far too long and the shoulders were too wide, but the waist was too small. Really loved the details and was looking forward to pairing it with mom jeans and heels.
Beautiful blazer with a relaxed fit; can be dressed up or down.
The sleeves are very long and can't be rolled because of the lining.
Sleeves seem really long and I think I rented a size too big for me but it is a well structured blazer and I liked it
This dress is light and airy and perfect for church and Sunday brunch. I had several compliments!

The dress was over sized but in a good way. Wore it to work and then a house warming party. Ended up have to walk a lot that day but the dress was so comfy I didn't mind at all- feels like wearing fresh sheets! Only con is that the elastic on the sleeve was a bit tight. Also Good length for the petites!! Will deff rent again:)
This dress runs big, so size down. So many compliments and super comfy!
Felt elegant and beautiful. The backless detail is stunning. The silhouette is flattering. Made me fall in love with this designer's work.

Super cute oversize design with belt to cinch in the waist. Perfect for everything from brunch to day date. Size 4 is perfect for me. Sizing up would give a more oversized look but would be too long. Would have probably worn more if it is not so easy to get dirty lol. The bottom of the dress is wide and prone to spills/dirt.

Ugh I really wanted to love this. At first I thought it was a little costume-y but I saw someone else in it and she looked gorgeous so I tried it... in the words of my boyfriend, "you look like you're in scrubs" sooo that's not great for what's supposed to be a pretty dress :( the open back idea is gorgeous but what bra can you wear ?! You can't. It's too much fabric & kinda looks cheap... which is unfortunate because i really wanted this to work!! Stuff i diiiid like can be found on @thanksitsrtr!
I ordered the 0 but I think I should of ordered the 2 the sleeves are very tight but you so don't need s bra which is AMAZE

Super cute dress and very comfortable. Downsides are that the back is very low so I had to wear a bandeau instead of a bra which worked great. The elastic around the arms could also cut into some people and be uncomfortable. I still enjoyed wearing it!
so liked this dress, it's a lot but nice for a weekend afternoon
This dress was perfect for wondering around Versailles! It was a tad large on top, but since you can cinch it with the black belt, it ended up fitting my tiny self very well.

I saw this at the RTR store but they only had a size 6. I tried it on even though it's 2 sizes bigger than normal. I actually really loved the oversized fit. It fit where it needed to. Wore it to a casual evening event and felt great!

links_reviews_title: Non stop compliments on the dress!
links_reviews_text: Definitely could have gone one size down but it was not supposed to be form fitting so it still worked and looked great.
Fit true to size except the elastic in the arms was a little too tight for my liking. Everything was perfect. Gorgeous design!
I wore this to welcome drinks during a weekend weekend and loved it! It was very comfortable and easy to adjust the waist. I wore sticky boobs due to the low back.

Not cute if you have a larger bust. Bra shows in back and bust looks top heavy when sash is tied. I love the color and wanted this to work but it just didn't look cute. I'm almost 5'5" and slim but my boobs are too big so it looked dumb. Bummed.
The material is not what I expected. Felt like a giant blue ballon with no shape.
too much fabric
It's a fun dress if you like baggy clothes, but it looked a little frumpy on me. I did not end up wearing it.

The dress ultimately just didn't look good on me. The waistline is higher than it appears in this picture, more of an empire. And the volume of the dress just didn't have any relief. Also the elastic arms were tight and uncomfortable, even just trying on. I loved the fabric and color, however.
Rented this for a brunch and then re-wore it to work because it's so cute! The belt ties perfectly and gives you a great waist.

links_reviews_title: There is something wrong with this design. I felt like I was wearing a bedsheet. Hmmmmm.
links_reviews_text: It looked like the sort of dress I'd be interested in. Wasn't to be, however, as it felt like I was trying to wear a hand-me-down from my older sister. It seriously reminded me of a bedsheet. Better luck next time.
The back was too low for a bra...needed to wear pasties

Definitely will make you stand out in a crowd - very fashionable but is not at all uncomfortable. If you're looking to show off your figure, this might not be for you (pretty tent shaped) but the belt does help. The back is a nice touch and makes it sexier than it would be otherwise. Only caution is that if you sweat, I probably wouldn't rent this because of the long sleeves, and because the fabric will show any sweat at all. I thought it was great for a dressy casual rehearsal dinner.
Size down at least one size. It runs really large. Once you've found the right size this dress works. It was flowy and eye catching.
Flowy and forgiving for those more casual days at the office. Cute detail with the elastic gathers. I always wish shirts were and inch or two longer.
So much to love about this top! Adorable pattern (not too crazy, hearts so cute), great fabric, well made. I really love it and will rent your wear again!

The pattern is hearts, but they are very subtle and make for a nice print. The blouse is super comfortable and flattering. You can tuck it in or leave it out, wear it with jeans or black pants or a skirt. Valentine's Day?

I ended up wearing this for a casual wfh day and it still made me feel pretty. It's super comfy, lightweight and the sleeves were the perfect amount of delicate flow & comfortable hold. The sleeves stay up when you want them pushed up and they're not too tight. I would buy this if it wasn't so much.

I would have prefered a large but it wasn't available so I went with Medium. It was a little tight in the shoulders but okay. love the sleeves and the pattern. Good for work with a pretty and femine flare

Very nice fabric and fit, loved the fun arm details. The body of the shirt is loose so if you are between sizes I'd go down. I could definitely have worn a M. Because of the full sleeve length and tightness on the arm it was warmer than I thought it would be (not a bad thing, more of winter transition than spring).

links_reviews_title: Cute top sleeves a bit long
links_reviews_text: This was a very fun flirty cute top that I got a lot of compliments on. I found that it ran true to size but the sleeves were a bit long on my petite arms. When you roll them up it takes away from the style of the top. It is also not long enough to wear with leggings, I wish it were longer. It does hide figure flaws though in the tummy how it blouses out, I liked that.
This was a great blouse that I would love to own. It felt great and was a flattering length. The sleeve details were a fun feature.
Wore this to dinner and work and received many compliments- L and XL fit almost the same. Hated to send it back.
The smocking on the cuffs makes this top interesting and fun. Runs large, I will wear it again but order it down a size

I wanted this sweater from the moment it started showing up in Kate Spade's look book, and it took awhile for my size to become available. I love it! So cute and and a little retro. Ultimately didn't buy because it's a wee bit short-waisted and I was self-consciously pulling it down a lot, but I regret not owning it.

links_reviews_title: Itchy and short even for me
links_reviews_text: I rented this in a WFH YOLO moment and I'm bummed. The sleeve cuffs are so ridiculously long I had to cuff them for the sweater to look normal. The length is also too short even for me-I have a short torso and it's still riding up in both the front and back. The sweater's material is also uncomfortable and itchy. Another unfortunate miss from Kate Spade :(
Didn't wear because it was pink and green glitter and slightly cropped. Not a flattering color combination.
Ran a little short and was a bit itchy, but got a handful of compliments on it.

LOVE this sweater! True to size. Sorry about awkward hand placement. It is sparkly like the other reviews said but I quite loved it. The tinsel-feel of the fabric wasn't itchy at all and didn't bother me in the least. Really flattering and a cool retro pattern. Definitely a favorite rental.
It's cropped, a bit more than I really like, but reviews exactly described that so I knew what to expect. Made good outfits with it. Love the color combo.
I enjoyed the sweater overall. Wear with higher waist pants. Didn't feel amazing like some pieces. It's a fun pattern that wears well.
Very unique sweater. A little itchy around the sleeves so can only wear for a short time. Tons of compliments on how different it is.
Absolutely this sweater! Very unique and flattering style. The spades are a little glittery which I don't think you can tell in photos. Loved the sweater so much that I purchased it.
Cute sweater, could be dressed up or down. The fabric is pretty sparkly but not too flashy. Overall nice fit. Slightly mock turtleneck and wide cuffs on sleeves.

links_reviews_title: Very fun sparkly sweater for the holidays!
links_reviews_text: I borrowed this for casual/work wear around the holidays. I used to always be a M in Kate Spade sweaters, but switched to L once Nicola took over as creative director and sizes changed a bit. Not too itchy or uncomfortable. I put a white collared shirt underneath, paired with jeans, and called it a day!
This is a terrible photo, but the sweater is very cute. The band at the bottom sits at waist level, so it works better with high waist pants. It is sparklier than in the Rtr photos

I ordered this for fun and love the Kate Spade sparkle for a Saturday errand kind of sweater. The thick band made it awkward to wear with most pants. It's also a greenish grey trim, so it doesn't go with everything. But again, pink sparkle so make it work ;)

links_reviews_title: Loved the colors and got many compliments
links_reviews_text: Fit great with high waisted jeans or high waisted skirt

I loved this sparkly, preppy sweater. It was comfortable and smooth textured, and very slim fitting. It was even more fun with the Kate Spade Pink Flower Shoulder Bag, also available on RTR, and matches perfectly! I liked the trendy Beatrice Patch Jeans with the outfit to offset the preppiness. All in all, a successful look!

I really liked this sweater. You can't tell it's sparkly in the photo but as others have said it has foil thread woven in and is shiny. The neck of the sweater that I received was bleached so I didn't actually get to wear it, but I wanted to!

links_reviews_title: Vacation canceled due to coronavirus - did not wear
links_reviews_text: Sparkler than expected... very party appropriate.
never wore it but it looked nice
Got many compliments. Very fun colors, a little sparkly, and super cute.

links_reviews_title: Great little casual sweater to mix up the everyday looks
links_reviews_text: Close fitting
This sweater is cute but is kinda itchy and a little too cropped for my taste. I wore it once but won't rent it again.

links_reviews_title: Great for work and girl's night.
links_reviews_text: Shirt is a soft charcol gray with a shimmery pinkish blush pattern. It was prettier in person than in the photos. Looked great with black dress pants at work and transitioned well for after work.
Took this with me to London and it went great with my jeans dressing them up. Would rent again

links_reviews_title: Super cute sweater, in person it has a fancy sparkle to it that runs through the patterning.
links_reviews_text: The fit is true to size/slightly small. Kind of has a vintage feel to it. Very cute, loved it!

As you can see from the photos, the sweater is on the shorter side and would pair best with high waisted pants. The colors and pattern are beautiful in person. The neck and arm ribbing is not too tight and looks good as well. Overall, if you have a long torso, consider a different choice.
I would have kept this sweater if it had been a touch longer. It was incredibly difficult to return it. I liked the subtle sparkle and fun pink/green pattern.
I loved the pattern and the sparkle. Fit perfectly, except that it was a little shorter than I prefer.... but I am long waisted, and seem to run into this problem quite a bit.
Didn't love this. The material is actually glittery, which I didn't notice from the photo. I went a size up and still found it very short.

Fun sweater. I got lots of compliments at work because it shimmers a bit in person - delightful! It can be a bit short so if you have a bust, a tank underneath will help with the annoyance of it riding up throughout the day.

links_reviews_title: Great sweater for work or the weekend.
links_reviews_text: Great sweater. Arrived in excellent condition. The material has a little bit of sparkle too it, but it's not over the top. I am usually a S/M and S worked well for me, but if I wanted it a little less fitted, I could have gone with M. Overall, a great rental and would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Cute, I should've gotten a S. Nice quality and fit.

links_reviews_text: I didn't end up wearing it because it was too itchy for me.

links_reviews_title: Cute, but a little itchy at first
links_reviews_text: I was worried this was going to be super itchy, but honestly by the time I was ready to leave for work I didn't even notice the initial scratchiness of putting it on. That being said, if you're super sensitive to texture, pass on this
This sweater was great. It was "sparklier" than I thought but still fantastic. Lots of compliments and very slimming.
Classy sweater that promotes an hourglass figure. Not to bold, interesting enough for feeling great at casual event.
Beautiful Kate Spade pattern, fit perfectly-- fun to wear

links_reviews_title: Love this beautiful, everyday classic with some sparkle
links_reviews_text: Fits a bit small, shorter in the torso. Paired with black pants and flats for a little more glam/sparkle office look.

I liked the look of the sweater, although the dark green/grey knit around the neck appeared to have old make-up stains on it or was simply worn. The sweater also arrived on a hanger so there were misshapen bulges in the shoulders. I do try to wear it and the metallic fibers were so Scratchy I took it off immediately and didn't try wearing it again. It was cute but definitely not functional.

links_reviews_title: Supposed to be a crop? sincerely, very confused
links_reviews_text: The pattern and colors are GORGEOUS and compliment each other perfectly. However, the sweater is almost a crop top on me? I was super confused. Still made it work with high waisted pants! I would recommend for a change up. It runs probably a 1/2 size small.

I absolutely adored this pattern and color scheme. Unfortunately, this sweater was too fitted/short for my personal taste and the neck line in unique, did not work with my frame. I tried styling many different ways but did not have luck. I know it will be adorable on a different body type.

links_reviews_title: Longest Rental I Have Kept - EVER
links_reviews_text: Fantastic coat, and loved it so much I almost bought it! Warm, chic, and SO many compliments every time I wore it. Would totally recommend renting this one.

This jacket is amazing. Surprisingly warm, almost ankle length. It had nice deep pockets and I didn't even need a purse when I wore it out. Wanted to buy it but one of the lapels was coming undone. I got so many compliments from guys and girls!!!

This was a great alternative to the black puffer that is usually my winter staple especially with the weather being so weird (cold-ish but not cold enough for a parka?) It was a good length, maybe a little long for my 5'5 frame but overall a really solid coat

I would say this jacket fits TTS in the arms but is a bit baggy everywhere else. It doesn't give much shape due to the bulky fit in the waist and hips. I still like it though. It's personal preference. The pattern and colors are great! A nice neutral jacket.
Loved it so much I bought it ! Very warm for winter!

Rented this for a trip back east in January, and it fit like a glove! I had been worried that it would be snug with a sweater underneath, but it wasn't, and I have broad shoulders. Not ultra warm, but definitely sufficient in 30 degrees with layering. Got lots of compliments! Would have bought it if I lived in a colder climate!
Gorgeous coat! Super fun to dress up or down and goes with everything! Absolutely loved this one!
Loved this coat! I ended up wearing it multiple times. It's warm and cozy, the fit is great and I got multiple compliments while wearing it!

links_reviews_title: Perfect look for party or casual
links_reviews_text: Was heavy duty and warm, looked cute over a dress but would also be appropriate to wear casually.
I loved this coat. It's so classy and sophisticated but way to wear with anything. Fits true to size if not a little baggy.

I throw this on almost every day. Goes with anything. Dress up or dress down. I have large chest so a bit tight to button but I usually leave it unbuttoned anyway. Have had this for over a month now. Loved!

This is warm quilt lined jacket. I loved this because it was long enough to walk around my neighborhood in Chicago paired with sneakers and still pretty enough to wear to more formal events at night. It was hard to give back!
A truly elegant looking WARM winter coat. Only 3 buttons so you'll want to wear a scarf. Big front pockets!

Loved this so much that I'm going to buy it. Very warm with a quilted lining but not too bulky. Versatile. Wore it to travel to SF & had random people walking up to me in the airport telling me how much they loved it. One of my favorite rentals to date.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for walking around London in Nov!
links_reviews_text: Rented for a work conference where I'd be walking around London. It was perfect and warm with fantastic deep pockets to hide phone, gloves or a hat. My only complaint was it was definitely a heavy coat - which was nice and warm but after walking around for 6 hours got a little heavy.

links_reviews_title: Chic and warm coat to complete a simple winter outfit
links_reviews_text: Sized up so my shoulders were comfortable, very warm and trendy plaid

Love this coat so much. The sleeves are on the snug side, which is flattering, but would not accommodate much more than this sweater. It buttons easily, perfect fit in the torso. There is a bit of beige in the weave, which adds to the versatility. Lining is quilted down, which makes the coat fit sleeker. Other pieces in the photo also from RTR.
Would be warm but only three buttons is not enough so it flaps open when you walk or sit. Tight in shoulders. Short on sleeves. But nice print, classy looking.
Love it, it's a little long but that's my only complaint
This was super cute and wonderfully lined. Couldn't wear it because the recommended size was too small in the shoulders.
Looking for tall girls over 5'10. Sleeves almost long enough! Which is rare. Loved the cut and plaid of the coat.

links_reviews_title: Cute but really tight in the armpit

links_reviews_text: I loved this jacket - it was warm and went well with jeans and with dresses. It came down to mid-shin for me, but that's the look I wanted. The sleeves and shoulders fit really well. I would have kept it all season, but it's been an unseasonably warm winter and I didn't want it to go to waste. Enjoy!

This coat made for a great way to mix up my normally black/grey/tan winter coat routine, without throwing me too far out of my comfort zone. It was a snug fit over thick sweaters, but otherwise fit true to size.

I liked this coat, it was unusual and got attention. It is lined with quilting, so very warm. I really liked it as a duster, hung a bit funny buttoned up. And, the arms were super tight. So, I couldn't really wear it with a sweater. This is a huge pet peeve with winter coats -- super narrow arms. Sheesh.

This coat is great! The pattern stands out in a sea of black puffer coats. The material is thick and warm, and I loved the long length, but I wish I'd ordered a size down because the oversized nature of the coat allowed for drafts to sneak in on windy days. I also love the look of the "blazer" neckline, but on really cold days, I wish I had a coat that covered more of my my neck...so plan to wear a scarf with this one if you're wearing it in colder climates. Overall, I'd recommend this rental.
A beautiful and very warm coat!
I loved this jacket and got a lot of compliments on it. It is a heavier jacket so only wear when you don't have to carry it around all night!

Rented this for a work trip in Boston (I live in miami!). It was perfectly warm with a puffy double lined interior. I accidentally rented the XS and I'm always a S, rarely XS and it was fitted and snug but still able to go over layers and be buttoned easily so if you're between sizes, consider going smaller. The length is great and attractive and it was easy to match. Great coat. Glad i rented it.
I knew this coat was gorgeous, but the compliments were so many I bought new because of it (Nordy with major sale). Perfect for someone who wants a formal coat for work with a little bit of flourish!

I love this jacket. I rented it for every day use but I think it's a bit much to wear with a regular outfit and is better for a formal night. I wore this on NYE and will rent again hopefully this winter. It's very warm and stylish.
Amazing coat that can handle even the coldest winter weather in Boston. It is roomy enough to fit sweaters underneath it, but structured enough to keep you from looking like a snowman. 10/10!
Loved this coat - warm and cute. I got tons of compliments!
This coat fit well, and looked chic and stylish, while being warm and cozy. It felt like hug, wish I could have kept it longer.
I sized up based on reviews but wish I would have went with a M. I find it tts. A M would have fit me better. The large was big everywhere. Regardless of size, it is a very nice coat!

links_reviews_title: Great coat for every day! Much warmer than I expected.
links_reviews_text: Great coat for every day but wish I had rented a small because the sleeves were pretty narrow. I wasn't expecting it to have the down inside (which is great for warmth) but didn't work when wearing a thicker sweater.
This jackets pattern is so cute but the shoulders are too wide and body on me. Also the chest is cold because the buttons start kind of low.

links_reviews_title: Kept this jacket for a month!
links_reviews_text: I absolutely could not let go of this jacket. I've had it for a month, have worn over 15 times and still have yet to return. It's long on me, but I'm 5'2. I actually like how long it is because it makes it extra warm. The inside is quilted, so it's warm, but it fits like a glove. Very flattering, chic and fashionable.

This is the perfect winter coat! Dress it up or down and it's perfect. I literally get stopped in parking lots...the bank...coffeehouse...grocery shopping with positive comments on this coat every time I wear it! It's the perfect length (I'm 5'4") and definitely keeps me warm is this already cold season in Wisconsin! If I don't purchase it, I will definitely rent again!

links_reviews_title: Great traditional plaid with quilted lining, VERY warm
links_reviews_text: I liked this one but it was VERY warm. I grabbed it for late fall and it would be better suited for mid-winter. It was oversized in the shoulders but otherwise fit TTS. It had pattern mixing details throughout that kept things interesting, and a thick quilted lining. Would rent again when it’s colder!
Loved this fit. The length was perfect, I am 5"9. The sleeves add a super fun element. I felt amazing in it.
Great dress for the winter! It's a heavy wool and a little itchy. It was so warm though I didn't feel I had to wear tights with it. The statement sleeve made this dreary NYC Monday a little brighter.

links_reviews_title: Oh my GOD I loved this
links_reviews_text: You cannot tell from the pictures online but this material is HEAVY. Like, so heavy that I wore this in the middle of November and I sweat a lot in it heavy. But other than that I loved that it was a little shorter than a lot of my work dresses- great for petite/shorter girls! I don't think I would've done this length at work without tights under it but again, it's a winter dress so that was fine. The waist for me snugly without being too tight and the arms are also just right.

This dress was much thicker than I was expecting, making it a solid winter choice. I liked it enough overall, but probably wouldn't rent again. The material was a little bit scratchy and it was decently-restrictive at the top. But definitely a fun, different dress. I got a couple of compliments throughout the day.

Loved this piece; it was very flattering and the fit was perfect. Wool material so it's warm for winter but a bit itchy in the shoulders where there's no lining. The color is beautiful and despite the itchy fabric I plan on renting it again!
Fits as expected but the material is incredibly thick and very itchy.

links_reviews_title: Pretty dress and very stylish but ITCHY AS HELL.
links_reviews_text: I'd wear this dress again except for the unbearably itchy fabric. Itchy all over; arms, neckline, waist, even my legs hurt from the bristly fabric. I wore the dress to work and hated my entire day. But the dress looks beautiful on - it's just horrible to wear.
Obsessed with this dress and got so so so many compliments!
Heavy wool material with no stretch. Looks great on but hard to move in.

links_reviews_title: Got so many compliments on this dress!
links_reviews_text: Only giving 4 stars because it was a bit itchy, but I LOVED this dress! Got so many compliments and almost decided to keep it.

links_reviews_title: I did not wear the dress to the event.
links_reviews_text: The material and the fit were both horrible.

This dress is so pretty in person. The wool is thick, so it was warm! Sleeves are unlined and itchy, but worth it. The waist and hips were a little baggy on me, but at 12 weeks postpartum, I didn't mind! If you're tall, this one might be a little short. I am 5'4" and it was long enough to wear to work and church, but it hit me well above the knee.

links_reviews_title: This dress is super great for work, the material is heavy and the cut is flattering.
links_reviews_text: The material is very heavy so it can be a little stiff.
Material is very thick and sleeves are a little itchy. I wanted to like it, but it made me look matronly.

links_reviews_title: This was a very pretty dress
links_reviews_text: Unfortunately the 8 I got was too small. My arms run big so I should've gotten a 10. would definitely rent again in a 10. This dress is not for warm weather, I had it on for about 20 minutes and was more than warm.

This was a great work dress. Heavy material which kept me warm in January in NYC. Was able to wear twice for work. Love the sleeves! My usual size 2 was not available so I took the size 4 and fit was great, shoulders and sleeves were perfect, body was a little loose, fit more like a shift which was very flattering.

links_reviews_title: Perfect work dress with a twist
links_reviews_text: What a great dress for work with a little fun twist. The sleeves are awesome! Heavy material, very warm but great for winter in Chicago. Paired it with brown knee high boots to give it a bit of a more casual look & it worked so well. No stretch so be sure to get the right size! 0 worked for me as it usually does but not a lot of room left: if you don't like a tight fit, size up.

links_reviews_title: Very cute for work or special event
links_reviews_text: I am normally a true 0, but I am so glad it was suggested to get a size up. The 2 fit perfectly. Snug around the right places and a little bit more dressy than I pictured, it is great for work or after work events. Only comment is that the sleeves are a statement, so just be ready to have them in the way sometimes!
I loved this dress. Great quality and design but the waist was way too big on my petite frame.
The dress runs true to size. It's a heavy material but very stylish. I was a bit warm in it. Also, the sleeves are not lines so it was a little itchy. I got lots of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Got a lot of compliments at work on this dress
links_reviews_text: Stylish with a decent fit. At 5'11'' it was a little short but I wore it with tights. The body was a little loose through the waist but the sleeves added some fun flair for work.
I found the heavy wool to be rather itchy and irritating on the arms so I didn't end up wearing it all day. Otherwise, really cute and flattering dress.

links_reviews_title: The material is high quality and style is flattering
links_reviews_text: Beautiful dress, very warm

links_reviews_title: Def too fancy for work but great for holiday party!
links_reviews_text: Fit perfectly but the sleeves are very wide so not great for work -- better for a work holiday party or dinner. It's also VERY thick and the sleeves aren't double lined so they're a little itchy but my sister almost bought it because she got so many compliments.

links_reviews_title: Very high quality, nice winter dress
links_reviews_text: Very nice dress for winter. Thick (although a little scratchy) and the lining is very high quality. Would definitely rent again!

Love the dress itself and the fit. I got a lot of compliments while wearing it at work, but unfortunately it is super itchy, which became increasingly more annoying over the course of the day. By the time I got home from work I couldn't wait to take it off. Adorable in appearance though. Very warm for cool weather.
Fabric was beautiful. But it ran small and did not have a lick of give.
Rented for work, fit was great and was an interesting change in normal work attire. Good color and material was forgiving. Would rent again for work events in the future.

links_reviews_title: Easy travel dress! Perfect for fall with long sleeves and flowy skirt.
links_reviews_text: Great dress! Wore in France for an extended trip and was easy to pack, layer, and felt relatively chic. The bodice has a funny tuck on one side but it's still great
This fit so perfectly - great amount of stretch in the chest. It's a kind of flirty yet conservative work dress.
Professional, yet sexy! Super flattering on and wow! I didn't think I would love this color so much!
I wore this for a ladies brunch on the UES and then again for work, dressed up and down with shoes and jewelry. Little clingy in the back and hips, otherwise loved! Long sleeves were perfect length.

links_reviews_title: Nice fabric in a forgiving cut
links_reviews_text: Good dress for hourglass figures. It's modest enough for work and has a nice fabric on it.

links_reviews_title: Love the color and the fit. I bought it and kept it.
links_reviews_text: I have curves (38-30-41; 34DD) and I am tall (5'10"). This dress has a nice modest length and neckline, making it great for work, yet it is very figure flattering. I received multiple compliments on the day that I wore it, which led to my purchasing it.

links_reviews_title: Great fit, works as a neutral.
links_reviews_text: Great fit.
Comfortable and simple yet sophisticated
Not the highest quality dress

links_reviews_title: Was going to wear it to church
links_reviews_text: May want to go a size up.
Nice work flare
The dress was so flattering and sat so nicely, I got so many compliments. Wore it to work and then transitioned nicely into a cookbook launch party

links_reviews_title: Comfortable, easy to wear, many compliments
links_reviews_text: Fit perfectly. Allowed full movement. Stretchy but thick material.

links_reviews_title: Conservative yet flowy dress for work
links_reviews_text: The cut is very comfortable to wear and the midi length and fabric flowed as I walked. It was fun to wear. I paired this dress with a pair of black boots for the winter.

links_reviews_title: Great fit! Actually rented it twice!
links_reviews_text: No cons! Wish they had this dress in more colors...
Loved how comfy this dress was, and that it didn't wrinkle much at all. Even though it's tight on top and a thin material, it wasn't see-through at all. Great color, easy to dress up or down.
Material felt thin and cheap. Wasn't very flattering so ended up not wearing it.
Great dress for work or daytime event!

links_reviews_title: This fit was great. It camouflaged without being frumpy.
links_reviews_text: The arms fits nicely and the waist draped well. I paired it with a wide belt and boots.
I know some others were bothered by the area "hidden" by the models hands, but I thought it was fine. A great dress for work.
This fit me, but was tight on chest and arms
Fit really well. The material is just amazing and I got so many compliments on it. Wanted to keep it! :)
The sleeves are long and this is a very basic dress, nothing wow about it
It was pretty. Medium was too small. I am an 8-10.
I generally love Leota but the pleat in this dress bunches up strangely right under the chest area (where the model is conveniently holding her arms)!

Wore this for a Brazilian jazz concert. Fit the theme perfectly. Glad I read other reviews to size up. Six fit perfectly. Absolutely no give in the fabric. Ruching is very flattering. Loved wearing this!
I got this in store in a size 4, it fits okay but the 6 would have been ideal. Love the color and ruffle!

Feels great on. Fabric is just lovely. I have a slim waist compared to my hips and it laid perfectly, which is not usually the case. There's a slit that goes to mid thigh. It didn't bother me, may some may be bothered by it. Really glad I rented it. It was perfect for work.
Comfortable, fun to wear.

links_reviews_title: Great ruffle skirt with beautiful color
links_reviews_text: Would size up if it was available but forgiving enough to get away with

links_reviews_title: beautiful color and good material but it was too long for me
links_reviews_text: beautiful color and good material but it was too long for me
Loved the true blue red and flair of the ruffle. Quality fabric and design, the only thing that doesn't make it 5 stars is it doesn't have a lining.

links_reviews_title: Too small and unforgiving at waste

links_reviews_text: Fit was a bit strange - looked great from the front but pulled in underneath my tummy which made it stick out a little. Would definitely need Spanx.

links_reviews_title: It was too tight to be comfortable at the waist.
links_reviews_text: Seems to run small. I am pretty solid in the 6-8 size range. This was really tight at the waist
This waist was VERY small. Did not wear. BEAUTIFUL though.
Super cute, so many compliments on it.
Beautiful skirt! Right on trend. Good quality. Would rent again.

I love the look and feel of this skirt... the color and the ruffle detail. The fabric is surprisingly soft. I usually wear a Medium, size 10/12 for most brands on average. For this skirt, the size 12 was just a little too small. It goes on and zips up okay, but pulls a little too tight around the hips. I am returning it without wearing it and will try the size 14. I look forward to pairing this with the matching blazer by the same designer.

Fit was pretty exact, so the other reviews about it being right at the waist were correct. But it worked really well for me and the slight draping in the fabric around the belly was just right. The color was perfect. I hate to send this one back!

links_reviews_title: Way too small. Couldn't even zip it halfway

links_reviews_text: True to size, high waisted, sits slightly below knee (I'm 5 ft 6) and is work appropriate but sassy and sexy for date night with knee high boots!
It was just a bit too snug for me, but it was very pretty. Good quality. Just not quite the right fit for me.

links_reviews_title: Sits high waisted... Waist is tiny. Size up!
links_reviews_text: The fabric and color are nice. There is ruffle detailing on the front left and a small slit in the front. The skirt has a slight stretch to the material... Except at the waist. The waist runs small. I rented a size 12 and the waist measures 15" across lying flat. Making the waist about 30" with no stretch. There is a side zipper. And it sits much more high waisted than on the model. It's a pretty skirt but consider sizing 1 size up.
Enhances curves and hides trouble areas. Very revealing in the bust. Classy all the way!

links_reviews_title: Hands down-- the perfect (relatively conservative) LBD ever!
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress on a date night in the middle of January to one of New York City's top restaurants-- this dress is now my new 'power' dress. Conservative yet sexy with the sweetheart neckline, hugs every curve yet falls below the knee; pair it with slender heels and you'll never want to take it off. Double tape if you've got a small chest like I do.
The cut is low and revealing even for someone with a smaller chest. It just didn't fit right for 5'1 -- a dress for 5'6 and taller and if you like the 50s glam.

I was hoping this would be work appropriate but it was definitely not. The neckline scoops very low. The 4 JUST fit me, like hugged every, single, curve. I have bigger hips (37-38") and this did fit okay, but like I said, very snug. My chest was also busting out which while I am not small, they are usually pretty tame. The sleeves were a cool detail so maybe this would be cute for certain cocktail parties but I didn't end up wearing since I wanted it for work.

links_reviews_title: Pretty but funny fit up top
links_reviews_text: I loved this dress it was perfect for a holiday party. The fit was true to size EXCEPT for the top. Incredibly deep neckline it worked perfect with a little safety pinning in the back. It seemed like it needed to have two inches takes off of the height at the shoulders. But with pins and long hair no one would ever know it was a flattering fit, if your chesty though it's probably a no go

Wasn't sure about this one when I saw it on the app, but it was winter break so a chance to try some things I was curious about. When I tried this on I LOVED it. Hugs in all the right places, the belt helps. I wore it to a holiday party. I think the cleavage might prevent me from wearing to work, but...maybe, with a scarf or something. Will def be looking for opps to rent this again!!

links_reviews_title: Much too small - but gorgeous details
links_reviews_text: I'd try a size or two up and rent again. Very pretty neckline and belt detail!

links_reviews_title: Pretty dress, but a bit small. Did not wear
links_reviews_text: Did not wear
Wore this out to dinner with heeled booties then to museums the next day with sandals. Kept me warm in Mexico City's breezy evening weather. Very unique style!

If i'm wearing an XL i sure am surprised, it fits pretty well. I think it's definitely better looking in person than in this picture. Styled it with snake booties like the model for a super cute look. Color and fabric are great.
Or this to family Thanksgiving. Everyone gave me compliments. It's a standout piece that is elegant and classy at the same time. Perfect color for brunettes with warm skin tones like me
Love the utility details here, like the pleats, elastic waist and belt. It's got 80s vibes, but in a good way. It's a power dress!

My husband called it my "Princess Bride" dress (it does look similar to the one Robin Wright wears haha) but that made me love it more. The lines are awesome, the pockets add the perfect flare and I got so many compliments. Such a winner.

links_reviews_title: Lots of compliments on the color
links_reviews_text: Great color and easy to throw on. It definitely ran big so be ready to size down 1-2 sizes. The belt really allows you to cinch it in to give you a shape.
Cute dress for a nice, casual "country" feel. Wore with low heeled brown boots. Chest area is very roomy and waist is nicely fitted. It does tend to wrinkle easily.

Got lots of compliments on this retro number. I felt i could have pulled off a small because there is an elastic waistband and the top was voluminous. I am large chested but you never would have known it in this dress. I am also 5'4" and this dress was mid calf for me, which is what i was looking for. Paired with black shortie boots for an edgier look.
Loved the color, fabric was heavy and had a drop waist that you didn't see well online.

links_reviews_title: Did not fit my petite frame
links_reviews_text: Was too long for my 5'2 frame. I also felt that the pockets were very awkwardly placed... perhaps if I was about 6 inches taller this would have looked fabulous. I LOVE the color thought and the fabric was really thick, perfect for fall.
Awkward fit with too much fabric
Great skirt - got lots of compliments at work. Worked well with a blazer and black top. Slightly long on my shorter frame, but still cute.

links_reviews_title: Who said no white after Labor Day?!
links_reviews_text: This skirt provided the perfect pop to my black outfit. Heavy enough to keep you warm in the winter and still chic enough to be a head turner!

Got tons of compliments on this skirt! It is beautiful and a very thick knit material, so it is perfect for cold days. The only cons: it came wrinkled, which I didn't realize until I was at work (yikes!) and it probably is best for tall girls (I'm 5'9" and it falls mid-shin).

The material of this skirt is thick- which makes it very forgiving. I'm typically a size 6 and wore a small (although a medium may have been more comfortable in the waist). I felt sophisticated and recieved many compliments!
Very long but I thought it was cute. Dressed up for work and then down once I got home.
Nice fit. Can be dressed up or down. I'll probably purchase it.
This skirt is a showstopper! Very flattering for hourglass shapes. Can't wait to wear a second time styled for cooler weather this weekend.
I wore this a few times. On a with top tucked in. 2 more times with black top untucked. Loved the fabric.

links_reviews_title: Striking and comfortable, a killer combo
links_reviews_text: I had a woman follow me out of Whole Foods to say how great this skirt was. And a stranger on stopped me on the street to compliment the skirt too. The skirt is easy to wear. I wore it twice -- once to work and once in the weekend with different black tanks. Midi-length came just above my ankle on my 5'4" frame. Skirt is more forgiving than it appears in the photo. Cons: it's a nearly floor length knit skirt so it is a little heavy but the thick waistband does most of the work, and I was very comfortable wearing it in mid-70 degree weather. And it is white knit so after two wears it was pretty dingy and I was happy to send it back to RTR for a cleaning!
I love everything about this skirt and so did all of my coworkers. I was comfortable and confident all day!

This skirt is incredibly long, heavy, and runs large. I'm about 5'7 and had to roll the top of the skirt to clear my ankles. The fabric is also very heavy. If you rent this, size down one to two sizes. Despite the flaws, it's a very cute skirt and I received tons of compliments.
I am usually a size 00 in jcrew bottoms this skirt is really tight. I suggest sizing up one size. Super cute if paid it with the matching top to complete the look.
Great winter time skirt for a party or work. Wore this multiple times and received so many compliments. Easy to style and really comfy. Great rental!

Loved this skirt and got tons of compliments! Fits true to size, I'm typically an 8/10 and medium fit perfectly. It was a bit longer on me that the photos because I'm 5'5 so it hit only a few inches above my ankles.

links_reviews_title: Great skirt for work or everyday!
links_reviews_text: Loved it - got lots of compliments. Wore my normal JCrew size. It's a little long - but easy to just wear higher on the waist. It was slimming, didn't show any lumps/bumps. The fabric is heavier which is nice for winter.

links_reviews_title: It was so comfortable, yet looked so chic! I got tons of compliments on it.
links_reviews_text: It fit true to size! I will say I have wider hips and still fit true to size, also it was very thick so perfect for winter!
A beautiful knit skirt! It's a little tight at the waist, but nothing uncomfortable. Highly recommend!
Simple skirt to wear to work, paired with a black cami and black cardigan
Heavy but strong fabric. Looked chic and was really comfortable.

links_reviews_title: Just not a good fit for a petite body.
links_reviews_text: I loved the model pictures of this skirt. I REALLY wanted to make it work. Unfortunately, it's just not a good fit for a petite frame. For one, it's long. I'm short - 5'4" and am all torso - very short legs. It just didn't look right. The picture makes it look like there's more black that there is as well- much more white peeks out.

It's beautiful in person. The fabric is heavy, which is great for fall and winter and the style goes with everything. It's also unique so it doesn't just feel like a normal work skirt. I will definitely rent this again!

This is a high-quality sweater skirt. Doesn't wrinkle, great weight, skims the hips and is really flattering. It is long, so keep that in mind when thinking about sizing. If you want to wear it on you waist vs hips, you may need a smaller size.

links_reviews_title: I received the most compliments wearing this skirt. It was super flattering.
links_reviews_text: The fit was great and probably would have been better had I not been pregnant at the time of wearing it. It went really well with the black sweater I wore with it but would look great with any style of shirt, black or a solid color. I would definitely wear again.
Loved the skirt, well made, beautiful and comfortable. Am 5'4" so would have loved a petite as it was slightly longer than a perfect maxi, but no one noticed. Tons of compliments. Super chic!

links_reviews_title: Pleated skirt look without the bulk
links_reviews_text: Wore with the Parker black Dora sweater for the most wonderful outfit. Loved how this skirt looks pleated but isn't. This makes for less bulk around the middle . Love J crew and would rent again.
Loved this skirt. I wore it for a conf and was so nervous overall. It made me feel styled, professional and confident.
Great fabric, fit and shape. It's on the long side, but cute overall.
This skirt is the best. It's slightly heavier weight but not overwhelming. It looks chic, moves well, and hits mid-calf. LOVE this skirt and will absolutely rent again.
Great skirt
The material was so thick it made the skirt uncomfortable and unflattering.
This one was just ok for me. It is comfortable, but the length is weird and it is a little boring.

links_reviews_title: I loved the fit of this but unfortunately didn't have a top to wear with it.
links_reviews_text: The fit was perfect and super flattering.

There have been 2 jackets I've rented and nearly bought- Alcoolique rainbow sequin bomber and this gorgeous leather piece right here! It's stunning and SO FUN.
